     106             : 
     107             : /**
     108             :  *      sk_filter_trim_cap - run a packet through a socket filter
     109             :  *      @sk: sock associated with &sk_buff
     110             :  *      @skb: buffer to filter
     111             :  *      @cap: limit on how short the eBPF program may trim the packet
     112             :  *
     113             :  * Run the eBPF program and then cut skb->data to correct size returned by
     114             :  * the program. If pkt_len is 0 we toss packet. If skb->len is smaller
     115             :  * than pkt_len we keep whole skb->data. This is the socket level
     116             :  * wrapper to BPF_PROG_RUN. It returns 0 if the packet should
     117             :  * be accepted or -EPERM if the packet should be tossed.
     118             :  *
     119             :  */
     120        1880 : int sk_filter_trim_cap(struct sock *sk, struct sk_buff *skb, unsigned int cap)
     121             : {
     122        1880 :         int err;
     123        1880 :         struct sk_filter *filter;
     124             : 
     125             :         /*
     126             :          * If the skb was allocated from pfmemalloc reserves, only
     127             :          * allow SOCK_MEMALLOC sockets to use it as this socket is
     128             :          * helping free memory
     129             :          */
     130        1880 :         if (skb_pfmemalloc(skb) && !sock_flag(sk, SOCK_MEMALLOC)) {
     131           0 :                 NET_INC_STATS(sock_net(sk), LINUX_MIB_PFMEMALLOCDROP);
     132           0 :                 return -ENOMEM;
     133             :         }
     134        1880 :         err = BPF_CGROUP_RUN_PROG_INET_INGRESS(sk, skb);
     135        1880 :         if (err)
     136             :                 return err;
     137             : 
     138        1880 :         err = security_sock_rcv_skb(sk, skb);
     139        1880 :         if (err)
     140             :                 return err;
     141             : 
     142        1880 :         rcu_read_lock();
     143        1880 :         filter = rcu_dereference(sk->sk_filter);
     144        1880 :         if (filter) {
     145         186 :                 struct sock *save_sk = skb->sk;
     146         186 :                 unsigned int pkt_len;
     147             : 
     148         186 :                 skb->sk = sk;
     149         186 :                 pkt_len = bpf_prog_run_save_cb(filter->prog, skb);
     150         185 :                 skb->sk = save_sk;
     151         185 :                 err = pkt_len ? pskb_trim(skb, max(cap, pkt_len)) : -EPERM;
     152             :         }
     153        1879 :         rcu_read_unlock();
     154             : 
     155        1879 :         return err;
     156             : }
     157             : EXPORT_SYMBOL(sk_filter_trim_cap);

     450           0 :                 *insn = BPF_ALU32_REG(BPF_XOR, BPF_REG_A, BPF_REG_X);
     451           0 :                 break;

     453          66 :         default:
     454             :                 /* This is just a dummy call to avoid letting the compiler
     455             :                  * evict __bpf_call_base() as an optimization. Placed here
     456             :                  * where no-one bothers.
     457             :                  */

     459             :                 return false;

     466          72 : static bool convert_bpf_ld_abs(struct sock_filter *fp, struct bpf_insn **insnp)
     467             : {
     468          72 :         const bool unaligned_ok = IS_BUILTIN(CONFIG_HAVE_EFFICIENT_UNALIGNED_ACCESS);
     469          72 :         int size = bpf_size_to_bytes(BPF_SIZE(fp->code));
     470          72 :         bool endian = BPF_SIZE(fp->code) == BPF_H ||
     471             :                       BPF_SIZE(fp->code) == BPF_W;
     472          72 :         bool indirect = BPF_MODE(fp->code) == BPF_IND;
     473          72 :         const int ip_align = NET_IP_ALIGN;
     474          72 :         struct bpf_insn *insn = *insnp;
     475          72 :         int offset = fp->k;
     476             : 
     477          72 :         if (!indirect &&
     478          72 :             ((unaligned_ok && offset >= 0) ||
     479             :              (!unaligned_ok && offset >= 0 &&
     480             :               offset + ip_align >= 0 &&
     481             :               offset + ip_align % size == 0))) {
     482          69 :                 bool ldx_off_ok = offset <= S16_MAX;
     483             : 
     484          69 :                 *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_TMP, BPF_REG_H);
     485          69 :                 if (offset)
     486          69 :                         *insn++ = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_SUB, BPF_REG_TMP, offset);
     487          69 :                 *insn++ = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JSLT, BPF_REG_TMP,
     488             :                                       size, 2 + endian + (!ldx_off_ok * 2));
     489          69 :                 if (ldx_off_ok) {
     490          69 :                         *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_SIZE(fp->code), BPF_REG_A,
     491             :                                               BPF_REG_D, offset);
     492             :                 } else {
     493           0 :                         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_TMP, BPF_REG_D);
     494           0 :                         *insn++ = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_ADD, BPF_REG_TMP, offset);
     495           0 :                         *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_SIZE(fp->code), BPF_REG_A,
     496             :                                               BPF_REG_TMP, 0);
     497             :                 }
     498          69 :                 if (endian)
     499          63 :                         *insn++ = BPF_ENDIAN(BPF_FROM_BE, BPF_REG_A, size * 8);
     500          69 :                 *insn++ = BPF_JMP_A(8);
     501             :         }
     502             : 
     503          72 :         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_ARG1, BPF_REG_CTX);
     504          72 :         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_ARG2, BPF_REG_D);
     505          72 :         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_ARG3, BPF_REG_H);
     506          72 :         if (!indirect) {
     507          69 :                 *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_IMM(BPF_REG_ARG4, offset);
     508             :         } else {
     509           3 :                 *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_ARG4, BPF_REG_X);
     510           3 :                 if (fp->k)
     511           3 :                         *insn++ = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_ADD, BPF_REG_ARG4, offset);
     512             :         }
     513             : 
     514          72 :         switch (BPF_SIZE(fp->code)) {
     515           6 :         case BPF_B:
     516           6 :                 *insn++ = BPF_EMIT_CALL(bpf_skb_load_helper_8);
     517           6 :                 break;
     518           9 :         case BPF_H:
     519           9 :                 *insn++ = BPF_EMIT_CALL(bpf_skb_load_helper_16);
     520           9 :                 break;
     521          57 :         case BPF_W:
     522          57 :                 *insn++ = BPF_EMIT_CALL(bpf_skb_load_helper_32);
     523          57 :                 break;
     524             :         default:
     525             :                 return false;
     526             :         }
     527             : 
     528          72 :         *insn++ = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JSGE, BPF_REG_A, 0, 2);
     529          72 :         *insn++ = BPF_ALU32_REG(BPF_XOR, BPF_REG_A, BPF_REG_A);
     530          72 :         *insn   = BPF_EXIT_INSN();
     531             : 
     532          72 :         *insnp = insn;
     533          72 :         return true;
     534             : }
     535             : 
     536             : /**
     537             :  *      bpf_convert_filter - convert filter program
     538             :  *      @prog: the user passed filter program
     539             :  *      @len: the length of the user passed filter program
     540             :  *      @new_prog: allocated 'struct bpf_prog' or NULL
     541             :  *      @new_len: pointer to store length of converted program
     542             :  *      @seen_ld_abs: bool whether we've seen ld_abs/ind
     543             :  *
     544             :  * Remap 'sock_filter' style classic BPF (cBPF) instruction set to 'bpf_insn'
     545             :  * style extended BPF (eBPF).
     546             :  * Conversion workflow:
     547             :  *
     548             :  * 1) First pass for calculating the new program length:
     549             :  *   bpf_convert_filter(old_prog, old_len, NULL, &new_len, &seen_ld_abs)
     550             :  *
     551             :  * 2) 2nd pass to remap in two passes: 1st pass finds new
     552             :  *    jump offsets, 2nd pass remapping:
     553             :  *   bpf_convert_filter(old_prog, old_len, new_prog, &new_len, &seen_ld_abs)
     554             :  */
     555          14 : static int bpf_convert_filter(struct sock_filter *prog, int len,
     556             :                               struct bpf_prog *new_prog, int *new_len,
     557             :                               bool *seen_ld_abs)
     558             : {
     559          14 :         int new_flen = 0, pass = 0, target, i, stack_off;
     560          14 :         struct bpf_insn *new_insn, *first_insn = NULL;
     561          14 :         struct sock_filter *fp;
     562          14 :         int *addrs = NULL;
     563          14 :         u8 bpf_src;
     564             : 
     565          14 :         BUILD_BUG_ON(BPF_MEMWORDS * sizeof(u32) > MAX_BPF_STACK);
     566          14 :         BUILD_BUG_ON(BPF_REG_FP + 1 != MAX_BPF_REG);
     567             : 
     568          14 :         if (len <= 0 || len > BPF_MAXINSNS)
     569             :                 return -EINVAL;
     570             : 
     571          14 :         if (new_prog) {
     572           7 :                 first_insn = new_prog->insnsi;
     573           7 :                 addrs = kcalloc(len, sizeof(*addrs),
     574             :                                 GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_NOWARN);
     575           7 :                 if (!addrs)
     576             :                         return -ENOMEM;
     577             :         }
     578             : 
     579          14 : do_pass:
     580          21 :         new_insn = first_insn;
     581          21 :         fp = prog;
     582             : 
     583             :         /* Classic BPF related prologue emission. */
     584          21 :         if (new_prog) {
     585             :                 /* Classic BPF expects A and X to be reset first. These need
     586             :                  * to be guaranteed to be the first two instructions.
     587             :                  */
     588          14 :                 *new_insn++ = BPF_ALU32_REG(BPF_XOR, BPF_REG_A, BPF_REG_A);
     589          14 :                 *new_insn++ = BPF_ALU32_REG(BPF_XOR, BPF_REG_X, BPF_REG_X);
     590             : 
     591             :                 /* All programs must keep CTX in callee saved BPF_REG_CTX.
     592             :                  * In eBPF case it's done by the compiler, here we need to
     593             :                  * do this ourself. Initial CTX is present in BPF_REG_ARG1.
     594             :                  */
     595          14 :                 *new_insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_CTX, BPF_REG_ARG1);
     596          14 :                 if (*seen_ld_abs) {
     597             :                         /* For packet access in classic BPF, cache skb->data
     598             :                          * in callee-saved BPF R8 and skb->len - skb->data_len
     599             :                          * (headlen) in BPF R9. Since classic BPF is read-only
     600             :                          * on CTX, we only need to cache it once.
     601             :                          */
     602          14 :                         *new_insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(struct sk_buff, data),
     603             :                                                   BPF_REG_D, BPF_REG_CTX,
     604             :                                                   offsetof(struct sk_buff, data));
     605          14 :                         *new_insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_W, BPF_REG_H, BPF_REG_CTX,
     606             :                                                   offsetof(struct sk_buff, len));
     607          14 :                         *new_insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_W, BPF_REG_TMP, BPF_REG_CTX,
     608             :                                                   offsetof(struct sk_buff, data_len));
     609          14 :                         *new_insn++ = BPF_ALU32_REG(BPF_SUB, BPF_REG_H, BPF_REG_TMP);
     610             :                 }
     611             :         } else {
     612           7 :                 new_insn += 3;
     613             :         }
     614             : 
     615         264 :         for (i = 0; i < len; fp++, i++) {
     616         243 :                 struct bpf_insn tmp_insns[32] = { };
     617         243 :                 struct bpf_insn *insn = tmp_insns;
     618             : 
     619         243 :                 if (addrs)
     620         162 :                         addrs[i] = new_insn - first_insn;
     621             : 
     622         243 :                 switch (fp->code) {
     623             :                 /* All arithmetic insns and skb loads map as-is. */
     624          93 :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_ADD | BPF_X:
     625             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_ADD | BPF_K:
     626             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_SUB | BPF_X:
     627             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_SUB | BPF_K:
     628             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_AND | BPF_X:
     629             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_AND | BPF_K:
     630             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_OR | BPF_X:
     631             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_OR | BPF_K:
     632             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_LSH | BPF_X:
     633             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_LSH | BPF_K:
     634             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_RSH | BPF_X:
     635             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_RSH | BPF_K:
     636             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_XOR | BPF_X:
     637             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_XOR | BPF_K:
     638             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_MUL | BPF_X:
     639             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_MUL | BPF_K:
     640             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_DIV | BPF_X:
     641             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_DIV | BPF_K:
     642             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_MOD | BPF_X:
     643             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_MOD | BPF_K:
     644             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_NEG:
     645             :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_ABS | BPF_W:
     646             :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_ABS | BPF_H:
     647             :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_ABS | BPF_B:
     648             :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_IND | BPF_W:
     649             :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_IND | BPF_H:
     650             :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_IND | BPF_B:
     651             :                         /* Check for overloaded BPF extension and
     652             :                          * directly convert it if found, otherwise
     653             :                          * just move on with mapping.
     654             :                          */
     655          93 :                         if (BPF_CLASS(fp->code) == BPF_LD &&
     656          66 :                             BPF_MODE(fp->code) == BPF_ABS &&
     657          66 :                             convert_bpf_extensions(fp, &insn))
     658             :                                 break;
     659         162 :                         if (BPF_CLASS(fp->code) == BPF_LD &&
     660          69 :                             convert_bpf_ld_abs(fp, &insn)) {
     661          69 :                                 *seen_ld_abs = true;
     662          69 :                                 break;
     663             :                         }
     664             : 
     665          24 :                         if (fp->code == (BPF_ALU | BPF_DIV | BPF_X) ||
     666             :                             fp->code == (BPF_ALU | BPF_MOD | BPF_X)) {
     667           0 :                                 *insn++ = BPF_MOV32_REG(BPF_REG_X, BPF_REG_X);
     668             :                                 /* Error with exception code on div/mod by 0.
     669             :                                  * For cBPF programs, this was always return 0.
     670             :                                  */
     671           0 :                                 *insn++ = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JNE, BPF_REG_X, 0, 2);
     672           0 :                                 *insn++ = BPF_ALU32_REG(BPF_XOR, BPF_REG_A, BPF_REG_A);
     673           0 :                                 *insn++ = BPF_EXIT_INSN();
     674             :                         }
     675             : 
     676          24 :                         *insn = BPF_RAW_INSN(fp->code, BPF_REG_A, BPF_REG_X, 0, fp->k);
     677          24 :                         break;
     678             : 
     679             :                 /* Jump transformation cannot use BPF block macros
     680             :                  * everywhere as offset calculation and target updates
     681             :                  * require a bit more work than the rest, i.e. jump
     682             :                  * opcodes map as-is, but offsets need adjustment.
     683             :                  */
     684             : 
     685             : #define BPF_EMIT_JMP                                                    \
     686             :         do {                                                            \
     687             :                 const s32 off_min = S16_MIN, off_max = S16_MAX;         \
     688             :                 s32 off;                                                \
     689             :                                                                         \
     690             :                 if (target >= len || target < 0)                  \
     691             :                         goto err;                                       \
     692             :                 off = addrs ? addrs[target] - addrs[i] - 1 : 0;         \
     693             :                 /* Adjust pc relative offset for 2nd or 3rd insn. */    \
     694             :                 off -= insn - tmp_insns;                                \
     695             :                 /* Reject anything not fitting into insn->off. */    \
     696             :                 if (off < off_min || off > off_max)                       \
     697             :                         goto err;                                       \
     698             :                 insn->off = off;                                     \
     699             :         } while (0)
     700             : 
     701           0 :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JA:
     702           0 :                         target = i + fp->k + 1;
     703           0 :                         insn->code = fp->code;
     704           0 :                         BPF_EMIT_JMP;
     705           0 :                         break;
     706             : 
     707          69 :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JEQ | BPF_K:
     708             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JEQ | BPF_X:
     709             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JSET | BPF_K:
     710             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JSET | BPF_X:
     711             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGT | BPF_K:
     712             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGT | BPF_X:
     713             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGE | BPF_K:
     714             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGE | BPF_X:
     715          69 :                         if (BPF_SRC(fp->code) == BPF_K && (int) fp->k < 0) {
     716             :                                 /* BPF immediates are signed, zero extend
     717             :                                  * immediate into tmp register and use it
     718             :                                  * in compare insn.
     719             :                                  */
     720          30 :                                 *insn++ = BPF_MOV32_IMM(BPF_REG_TMP, fp->k);
     721             : 
     722          30 :                                 insn->dst_reg = BPF_REG_A;
     723          30 :                                 insn->src_reg = BPF_REG_TMP;
     724          30 :                                 bpf_src = BPF_X;
     725             :                         } else {
     726          39 :                                 insn->dst_reg = BPF_REG_A;
     727          39 :                                 insn->imm = fp->k;
     728          39 :                                 bpf_src = BPF_SRC(fp->code);
     729          78 :                                 insn->src_reg = bpf_src == BPF_X ? BPF_REG_X : 0;
     730             :                         }
     731             : 
     732             :                         /* Common case where 'jump_false' is next insn. */
     733          69 :                         if (fp->jf == 0) {
     734          33 :                                 insn->code = BPF_JMP | BPF_OP(fp->code) | bpf_src;
     735          33 :                                 target = i + fp->jt + 1;
     736          33 :                                 BPF_EMIT_JMP;
     737          33 :                                 break;
     738             :                         }
     739             : 
     740             :                         /* Convert some jumps when 'jump_true' is next insn. */
     741          36 :                         if (fp->jt == 0) {
     742          36 :                                 switch (BPF_OP(fp->code)) {
     743          36 :                                 case BPF_JEQ:
     744          36 :                                         insn->code = BPF_JMP | BPF_JNE | bpf_src;
     745          36 :                                         break;
     746           0 :                                 case BPF_JGT:
     747           0 :                                         insn->code = BPF_JMP | BPF_JLE | bpf_src;
     748           0 :                                         break;
     749           0 :                                 case BPF_JGE:
     750           0 :                                         insn->code = BPF_JMP | BPF_JLT | bpf_src;
     751           0 :                                         break;
     752           0 :                                 default:
     753           0 :                                         goto jmp_rest;
     754             :                                 }
     755             : 
     756          36 :                                 target = i + fp->jf + 1;
     757          36 :                                 BPF_EMIT_JMP;
     758          36 :                                 break;
     759             :                         }
     760           0 : jmp_rest:
     761             :                         /* Other jumps are mapped into two insns: Jxx and JA. */
     762           0 :                         target = i + fp->jt + 1;
     763           0 :                         insn->code = BPF_JMP | BPF_OP(fp->code) | bpf_src;
     764           0 :                         BPF_EMIT_JMP;
     765           0 :                         insn++;
     766             : 
     767           0 :                         insn->code = BPF_JMP | BPF_JA;
     768           0 :                         target = i + fp->jf + 1;
     769           0 :                         BPF_EMIT_JMP;
     770           0 :                         break;
     771             : 
     772             :                 /* ldxb 4 * ([14] & 0xf) is remaped into 6 insns. */
     773           3 :                 case BPF_LDX | BPF_MSH | BPF_B: {
     774           3 :                         struct sock_filter tmp = {
     775             :                                 .code   = BPF_LD | BPF_ABS | BPF_B,
     776           3 :                                 .k      = fp->k,
     777             :                         };
     778             : 
     779           3 :                         *seen_ld_abs = true;
     780             : 
     781             :                         /* X = A */
     782           3 :                         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_X, BPF_REG_A);
     783             :                         /* A = BPF_R0 = *(u8 *) (skb->data + K) */
     784           3 :                         convert_bpf_ld_abs(&tmp, &insn);
     785           3 :                         insn++;
     786             :                         /* A &= 0xf */
     787           3 :                         *insn++ = BPF_ALU32_IMM(BPF_AND, BPF_REG_A, 0xf);
     788             :                         /* A <<= 2 */
     789           3 :                         *insn++ = BPF_ALU32_IMM(BPF_LSH, BPF_REG_A, 2);
     790             :                         /* tmp = X */
     791           3 :                         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_TMP, BPF_REG_X);
     792             :                         /* X = A */
     793           3 :                         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_X, BPF_REG_A);
     794             :                         /* A = tmp */
     795           3 :                         *insn = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_A, BPF_REG_TMP);
     796           3 :                         break;
     797             :                 }
     798             :                 /* RET_K is remaped into 2 insns. RET_A case doesn't need an
     799             :                  * extra mov as BPF_REG_0 is already mapped into BPF_REG_A.
     800             :                  */
     801          78 :                 case BPF_RET | BPF_A:
     802             :                 case BPF_RET | BPF_K:
     803          78 :                         if (BPF_RVAL(fp->code) == BPF_K)

     805             :                                                         0, fp->k);

     808             : 
     809             :                 /* Store to stack. */
     810           0 :                 case BPF_ST:

     814             :                                             BPF_ST ? BPF_REG_A : BPF_REG_X,
     815             :                                             -stack_off);

     818             :                          * stack_depth for ST|STX insns is enough
     819             :                          */
     820           0 :                         if (new_prog && new_prog->aux->stack_depth < stack_off)
     821           0 :                                 new_prog->aux->stack_depth = stack_off;
     822             :                         break;
     823             : 
     824             :                 /* Load from stack. */
     825           0 :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_MEM:

     827           0 :                         stack_off = fp->k * 4  + 4;

     830             :                                             -stack_off);
     831           0 :                         break;
     832             : 
     833             :                 /* A = K or X = K */
     834           0 :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_IMM:
     835             :                 case BPF_LDX | BPF_IMM:
     836           0 :                         *insn = BPF_MOV32_IMM(BPF_CLASS(fp->code) == BPF_LD ?
     837             :                                               BPF_REG_A : BPF_REG_X, fp->k);
     838           0 :                         break;
     839             : 
     840             :                 /* X = A */
     841           0 :                 case BPF_MISC | BPF_TAX:
     842           0 :                         *insn = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_X, BPF_REG_A);
     843           0 :                         break;
     844             : 
     845             :                 /* A = X */
     846           0 :                 case BPF_MISC | BPF_TXA:
     847           0 :                         *insn = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_A, BPF_REG_X);
     848           0 :                         break;
     849             : 
     850             :                 /* A = skb->len or X = skb->len */
     851           0 :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_W | BPF_LEN:
     852             :                 case BPF_LDX | BPF_W | BPF_LEN:
     853           0 :                         *insn = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_W, BPF_CLASS(fp->code) == BPF_LD ?
     854             :                                             BPF_REG_A : BPF_REG_X, BPF_REG_CTX,
     855             :                                             offsetof(struct sk_buff, len));
     856           0 :                         break;
     857             : 
     858             :                 /* Access seccomp_data fields. */
     859           0 :                 case BPF_LDX | BPF_ABS | BPF_W:
     860             :                         /* A = *(u32 *) (ctx + K) */
     861           0 :                         *insn = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_W, BPF_REG_A, BPF_REG_CTX, fp->k);
     862           0 :                         break;
     863             : 
     864             :                 /* Unknown instruction. */
     865           0 :                 default:
     866           0 :                         goto err;
     867             :                 }
     868             : 
     869         243 :                 insn++;
     870         243 :                 if (new_prog)
     871         162 :                         memcpy(new_insn, tmp_insns,
     872         162 :                                sizeof(*insn) * (insn - tmp_insns));
     873         243 :                 new_insn += insn - tmp_insns;
     874             :         }
     875             : 
     876          21 :         if (!new_prog) {
     877             :                 /* Only calculating new length. */
     878           7 :                 *new_len = new_insn - first_insn;
     879           7 :                 if (*seen_ld_abs)
     880           7 :                         *new_len += 4; /* Prologue bits. */
     881           7 :                 return 0;
     882             :         }
     883             : 
     884          14 :         pass++;
     885          14 :         if (new_flen != new_insn - first_insn) {
     886           7 :                 new_flen = new_insn - first_insn;
     887           7 :                 if (pass > 2)
     888           0 :                         goto err;
     889           7 :                 goto do_pass;
     890             :         }
     891             : 
     892           7 :         kfree(addrs);
     893           7 :         BUG_ON(*new_len != new_flen);
     894             :         return 0;
     895           0 : err:
     896           0 :         kfree(addrs);
     897           0 :         return -EINVAL;
     898             : }
     899             : 
     900             : /* Security:
     901             :  *
     902             :  * As we dont want to clear mem[] array for each packet going through
     903             :  * __bpf_prog_run(), we check that filter loaded by user never try to read
     904             :  * a cell if not previously written, and we check all branches to be sure
     905             :  * a malicious user doesn't try to abuse us.
     906             :  */
     907           7 : static int check_load_and_stores(const struct sock_filter *filter, int flen)
     908             : {
     909           7 :         u16 *masks, memvalid = 0; /* One bit per cell, 16 cells */
     910           7 :         int pc, ret = 0;
     911             : 
     912           7 :         BUILD_BUG_ON(BPF_MEMWORDS > 16);
     913             : 
     914           7 :         masks = kmalloc_array(flen, sizeof(*masks), GFP_KERNEL);
     915           7 :         if (!masks)
     916             :                 return -ENOMEM;
     917             : 
     918           7 :         memset(masks, 0xff, flen * sizeof(*masks));
     919             : 
     920          88 :         for (pc = 0; pc < flen; pc++) {
     921          81 :                 memvalid &= masks[pc];
     922             : 
     923          81 :                 switch (filter[pc].code) {
     924           0 :                 case BPF_ST:
     925             :                 case BPF_STX:
     926           0 :                         memvalid |= (1 << filter[pc].k);
     927           0 :                         break;
     928           0 :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_MEM:
     929             :                 case BPF_LDX | BPF_MEM:
     930           0 :                         if (!(memvalid & (1 << filter[pc].k))) {
     931           0 :                                 ret = -EINVAL;
     932           0 :                                 goto error;
     933             :                         }
     934             :                         break;
     935           0 :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JA:
     936             :                         /* A jump must set masks on target */
     937           0 :                         masks[pc + 1 + filter[pc].k] &= memvalid;
     938           0 :                         memvalid = ~0;
     939           0 :                         break;
     940          23 :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JEQ | BPF_K:
     941             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JEQ | BPF_X:
     942             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGE | BPF_K:
     943             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGE | BPF_X:
     944             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGT | BPF_K:
     945             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGT | BPF_X:
     946             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JSET | BPF_K:
     947             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JSET | BPF_X:
     948             :                         /* A jump must set masks on targets */
     949          23 :                         masks[pc + 1 + filter[pc].jt] &= memvalid;
     950          23 :                         masks[pc + 1 + filter[pc].jf] &= memvalid;
     951          23 :                         memvalid = ~0;
     952          23 :                         break;
     953             :                 }
     954          81 :         }
     955           7 : error:
     956           7 :         kfree(masks);
     957           7 :         return ret;
     958             : }
     959             : 
     960          81 : static bool chk_code_allowed(u16 code_to_probe)
     961             : {
     962          81 :         static const bool codes[] = {
     963             :                 /* 32 bit ALU operations */
     964             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_ADD | BPF_K] = true,
     965             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_ADD | BPF_X] = true,
     966             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_SUB | BPF_K] = true,
     967             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_SUB | BPF_X] = true,
     968             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_MUL | BPF_K] = true,
     969             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_MUL | BPF_X] = true,
     970             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_DIV | BPF_K] = true,
     971             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_DIV | BPF_X] = true,
     972             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_MOD | BPF_K] = true,
     973             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_MOD | BPF_X] = true,
     974             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_AND | BPF_K] = true,
     975             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_AND | BPF_X] = true,
     976             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_OR | BPF_K] = true,
     977             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_OR | BPF_X] = true,
     978             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_XOR | BPF_K] = true,
     979             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_XOR | BPF_X] = true,
     980             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_LSH | BPF_K] = true,
     981             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_LSH | BPF_X] = true,
     982             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_RSH | BPF_K] = true,
     983             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_RSH | BPF_X] = true,
     984             :                 [BPF_ALU | BPF_NEG] = true,
     985             :                 /* Load instructions */
     986             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_W | BPF_ABS] = true,
     987             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_H | BPF_ABS] = true,
     988             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_B | BPF_ABS] = true,
     989             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_W | BPF_LEN] = true,
     990             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_W | BPF_IND] = true,
     991             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_H | BPF_IND] = true,
     992             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_B | BPF_IND] = true,
     993             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_IMM] = true,
     994             :                 [BPF_LD | BPF_MEM] = true,
     995             :                 [BPF_LDX | BPF_W | BPF_LEN] = true,
     996             :                 [BPF_LDX | BPF_B | BPF_MSH] = true,
     997             :                 [BPF_LDX | BPF_IMM] = true,
     998             :                 [BPF_LDX | BPF_MEM] = true,
     999             :                 /* Store instructions */
    1000             :                 [BPF_ST] = true,
    1001             :                 [BPF_STX] = true,
    1002             :                 /* Misc instructions */
    1003             :                 [BPF_MISC | BPF_TAX] = true,
    1004             :                 [BPF_MISC | BPF_TXA] = true,
    1005             :                 /* Return instructions */
    1006             :                 [BPF_RET | BPF_K] = true,
    1007             :                 [BPF_RET | BPF_A] = true,
    1008             :                 /* Jump instructions */
    1009             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JA] = true,
    1010             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JEQ | BPF_K] = true,
    1011             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JEQ | BPF_X] = true,
    1012             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JGE | BPF_K] = true,
    1013             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JGE | BPF_X] = true,
    1014             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JGT | BPF_K] = true,
    1015             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JGT | BPF_X] = true,
    1016             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JSET | BPF_K] = true,
    1017             :                 [BPF_JMP | BPF_JSET | BPF_X] = true,
    1018             :         };
    1019             : 
    1020          81 :         if (code_to_probe >= ARRAY_SIZE(codes))
    1021             :                 return false;
    1022             : 
    1023          81 :         return codes[code_to_probe];
    1024             : }
    1025             : 
    1026           7 : static bool bpf_check_basics_ok(const struct sock_filter *filter,
    1027             :                                 unsigned int flen)
    1028             : {
    1029           7 :         if (filter == NULL)
    1030             :                 return false;
    1031           7 :         if (flen == 0 || flen > BPF_MAXINSNS)
    1032             :                 return false;
    1033             : 
    1034             :         return true;
    1035             : }
    1036             : 
    1037             : /**
    1038             :  *      bpf_check_classic - verify socket filter code
    1039             :  *      @filter: filter to verify
    1040             :  *      @flen: length of filter
    1041             :  *
    1042             :  * Check the user's filter code. If we let some ugly
    1043             :  * filter code slip through kaboom! The filter must contain
    1044             :  * no references or jumps that are out of range, no illegal
    1045             :  * instructions, and must end with a RET instruction.
    1046             :  *
    1047             :  * All jumps are forward as they are not signed.
    1048             :  *
    1049             :  * Returns 0 if the rule set is legal or -EINVAL if not.
    1050             :  */
    1051           7 : static int bpf_check_classic(const struct sock_filter *filter,
    1052             :                              unsigned int flen)
    1053             : {
    1054           7 :         bool anc_found;
    1055           7 :         int pc;
    1056             : 
    1057             :         /* Check the filter code now */
    1058          88 :         for (pc = 0; pc < flen; pc++) {
    1059          81 :                 const struct sock_filter *ftest = &filter[pc];
    1060             : 
    1061             :                 /* May we actually operate on this code? */
    1062          81 :                 if (!chk_code_allowed(ftest->code))
    1063             :                         return -EINVAL;
    1064             : 
    1065             :                 /* Some instructions need special checks */
    1066          81 :                 switch (ftest->code) {
    1067           0 :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_DIV | BPF_K:
    1068             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_MOD | BPF_K:
    1069             :                         /* Check for division by zero */
    1070           0 :                         if (ftest->k == 0)
    1071             :                                 return -EINVAL;
    1072             :                         break;
    1073           0 :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_LSH | BPF_K:
    1074             :                 case BPF_ALU | BPF_RSH | BPF_K:
    1075           0 :                         if (ftest->k >= 32)
    1076             :                                 return -EINVAL;
    1077             :                         break;
    1078           0 :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_MEM:
    1079             :                 case BPF_LDX | BPF_MEM:
    1080             :                 case BPF_ST:
    1081             :                 case BPF_STX:
    1082             :                         /* Check for invalid memory addresses */
    1083           0 :                         if (ftest->k >= BPF_MEMWORDS)
    1084             :                                 return -EINVAL;
    1085             :                         break;
    1086           0 :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JA:
    1087             :                         /* Note, the large ftest->k might cause loops.
    1088             :                          * Compare this with conditional jumps below,
    1089             :                          * where offsets are limited. --ANK (981016)
    1090             :                          */
    1091           0 :                         if (ftest->k >= (unsigned int)(flen - pc - 1))
    1092             :                                 return -EINVAL;
    1093             :                         break;
    1094          23 :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JEQ | BPF_K:
    1095             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JEQ | BPF_X:
    1096             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGE | BPF_K:
    1097             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGE | BPF_X:
    1098             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGT | BPF_K:
    1099             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JGT | BPF_X:
    1100             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JSET | BPF_K:
    1101             :                 case BPF_JMP | BPF_JSET | BPF_X:
    1102             :                         /* Both conditionals must be safe */
    1103          23 :                         if (pc + ftest->jt + 1 >= flen ||
    1104          23 :                             pc + ftest->jf + 1 >= flen)
    1105             :                                 return -EINVAL;
    1106             :                         break;
    1107          22 :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_W | BPF_ABS:
    1108             :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_H | BPF_ABS:
    1109             :                 case BPF_LD | BPF_B | BPF_ABS:
    1110          22 :                         anc_found = false;
    1111          22 :                         if (bpf_anc_helper(ftest) & BPF_ANC)
    1112             :                                 anc_found = true;
    1113             :                         /* Ancillary operation unknown or unsupported */
    1114          22 :                         if (anc_found == false && ftest->k >= SKF_AD_OFF)
    1115             :                                 return -EINVAL;
    1116             :                 }
    1117             :         }
    1118             : 
    1119             :         /* Last instruction must be a RET code */
    1120           7 :         switch (filter[flen - 1].code) {
    1121           7 :         case BPF_RET | BPF_K:
    1122             :         case BPF_RET | BPF_A:
    1123           7 :                 return check_load_and_stores(filter, flen);
    1124             :         }
    1125             : 
    1126             :         return -EINVAL;
    1127             : }
    1128             : 
    1129           7 : static int bpf_prog_store_orig_filter(struct bpf_prog *fp,
    1130             :                                       const struct sock_fprog *fprog)
    1131             : {
    1132           7 :         unsigned int fsize = bpf_classic_proglen(fprog);
    1133           7 :         struct sock_fprog_kern *fkprog;
    1134             : 
    1135           7 :         fp->orig_prog = kmalloc(sizeof(*fkprog), GFP_KERNEL);
    1136           7 :         if (!fp->orig_prog)
    1137             :                 return -ENOMEM;
    1138             : 
    1139           7 :         fkprog = fp->orig_prog;
    1140           7 :         fkprog->len = fprog->len;
    1141             : 
    1142           7 :         fkprog->filter = kmemdup(fp->insns, fsize,
    1143             :                                  GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_NOWARN);
    1144           7 :         if (!fkprog->filter) {
    1145           0 :                 kfree(fp->orig_prog);
    1146           0 :                 return -ENOMEM;
    1147             :         }
    1148             : 
    1149             :         return 0;
    1150             : }
    1151             : 
    1152           0 : static void bpf_release_orig_filter(struct bpf_prog *fp)
    1153             : {
    1154           0 :         struct sock_fprog_kern *fprog = fp->orig_prog;
    1155             : 
    1156           0 :         if (fprog) {
    1157           0 :                 kfree(fprog->filter);
    1158           0 :                 kfree(fprog);
    1159             :         }
    1160           0 : }
    1161             : 
    1162           0 : static void __bpf_prog_release(struct bpf_prog *prog)
    1163             : {
    1164           0 :         if (prog->type == BPF_PROG_TYPE_SOCKET_FILTER) {
    1165           0 :                 bpf_prog_put(prog);
    1166             :         } else {
    1167           0 :                 bpf_release_orig_filter(prog);
    1168           0 :                 bpf_prog_free(prog);
    1169             :         }
    1170           0 : }

    1172           0 : static void __sk_filter_release(struct sk_filter *fp)
    1173             : {
    1174           0 :         __bpf_prog_release(fp->prog);
    1175           0 :         kfree(fp);
    1176           0 : }
    1177             : 
    1178             : /**
    1179             :  *      sk_filter_release_rcu - Release a socket filter by rcu_head
    1180             :  *      @rcu: rcu_head that contains the sk_filter to free

    1182           0 : static void sk_filter_release_rcu(struct rcu_head *rcu)
    1183             : {
    1184           0 :         struct sk_filter *fp = container_of(rcu, struct sk_filter, rcu);
    1185             : 
    1186           0 :         __sk_filter_release(fp);

    1188             : 
    1189             : /**
    1190             :  *      sk_filter_release - release a socket filter
    1191             :  *      @fp: filter to remove
    1192             :  *
    1193             :  *      Remove a filter from a socket and release its resources.
    1194             :  */
    1195           0 : static void sk_filter_release(struct sk_filter *fp)
    1196             : {
    1197           0 :         if (refcount_dec_and_test(&fp->refcnt))
    1198           0 :                 call_rcu(&fp->rcu, sk_filter_release_rcu);
    1199           0 : }
    1200             : 
    1201           0 : void sk_filter_uncharge(struct sock *sk, struct sk_filter *fp)
    1202             : {
    1203           0 :         u32 filter_size = bpf_prog_size(fp->prog->len);
    1204             : 
    1205           0 :         atomic_sub(filter_size, &sk->sk_omem_alloc);
    1206           0 :         sk_filter_release(fp);
    1207           0 : }
    1208             : 
    1209             : /* try to charge the socket memory if there is space available
    1210             :  * return true on success
    1211             :  */
    1212           7 : static bool __sk_filter_charge(struct sock *sk, struct sk_filter *fp)
    1213             : {
    1214           7 :         u32 filter_size = bpf_prog_size(fp->prog->len);
    1215             : 
    1216             :         /* same check as in sock_kmalloc() */
    1217           7 :         if (filter_size <= sysctl_optmem_max &&
    1218           7 :             atomic_read(&sk->sk_omem_alloc) + filter_size < sysctl_optmem_max) {
    1219           7 :                 atomic_add(filter_size, &sk->sk_omem_alloc);
    1220           7 :                 return true;
    1221             :         }
    1222             :         return false;
    1223             : }
    1224             : 
    1225           0 : bool sk_filter_charge(struct sock *sk, struct sk_filter *fp)
    1226             : {
    1227           0 :         if (!refcount_inc_not_zero(&fp->refcnt))
    1228             :                 return false;
    1229             : 
    1230           0 :         if (!__sk_filter_charge(sk, fp)) {
    1231           0 :                 sk_filter_release(fp);
    1232           0 :                 return false;
    1233             :         }
    1234             :         return true;
    1235             : }
    1236             : 
    1237           7 : static struct bpf_prog *bpf_migrate_filter(struct bpf_prog *fp)
    1238             : {
    1239           7 :         struct sock_filter *old_prog;
    1240           7 :         struct bpf_prog *old_fp;
    1241           7 :         int err, new_len, old_len = fp->len;
    1242           7 :         bool seen_ld_abs = false;
    1243             : 
    1244             :         /* We are free to overwrite insns et al right here as it
    1245             :          * won't be used at this point in time anymore internally
    1246             :          * after the migration to the internal BPF instruction
    1247             :          * representation.
    1248             :          */
    1249           7 :         BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof(struct sock_filter) !=
    1250             :                      sizeof(struct bpf_insn));
    1251             : 
    1252             :         /* Conversion cannot happen on overlapping memory areas,
    1253             :          * so we need to keep the user BPF around until the 2nd
    1254             :          * pass. At this time, the user BPF is stored in fp->insns.
    1255             :          */
    1256           7 :         old_prog = kmemdup(fp->insns, old_len * sizeof(struct sock_filter),
    1257             :                            GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_NOWARN);
    1258           7 :         if (!old_prog) {
    1259           0 :                 err = -ENOMEM;
    1260           0 :                 goto out_err;
    1261             :         }
    1262             : 
    1263             :         /* 1st pass: calculate the new program length. */
    1264           7 :         err = bpf_convert_filter(old_prog, old_len, NULL, &new_len,
    1265             :                                  &seen_ld_abs);
    1266           7 :         if (err)
    1267           0 :                 goto out_err_free;
    1268             : 
    1269             :         /* Expand fp for appending the new filter representation. */
    1270           7 :         old_fp = fp;
    1271           7 :         fp = bpf_prog_realloc(old_fp, bpf_prog_size(new_len), 0);
    1272           7 :         if (!fp) {
    1273             :                 /* The old_fp is still around in case we couldn't
    1274             :                  * allocate new memory, so uncharge on that one.
    1275             :                  */
    1276           0 :                 fp = old_fp;
    1277           0 :                 err = -ENOMEM;
    1278           0 :                 goto out_err_free;
    1279             :         }
    1280             : 
    1281           7 :         fp->len = new_len;
    1282             : 
    1283             :         /* 2nd pass: remap sock_filter insns into bpf_insn insns. */
    1284           7 :         err = bpf_convert_filter(old_prog, old_len, fp, &new_len,
    1285             :                                  &seen_ld_abs);
    1286           7 :         if (err)
    1287             :                 /* 2nd bpf_convert_filter() can fail only if it fails
    1288             :                  * to allocate memory, remapping must succeed. Note,
    1289             :                  * that at this time old_fp has already been released
    1290             :                  * by krealloc().
    1291             :                  */
    1292           0 :                 goto out_err_free;
    1293             : 
    1294           7 :         fp = bpf_prog_select_runtime(fp, &err);
    1295           7 :         if (err)
    1296           0 :                 goto out_err_free;
    1297             : 
    1298           7 :         kfree(old_prog);
    1299           7 :         return fp;
    1300             : 
    1301           0 : out_err_free:
    1302           0 :         kfree(old_prog);
    1303           0 : out_err:
    1304           0 :         __bpf_prog_release(fp);
    1305           0 :         return ERR_PTR(err);
    1306             : }
    1307             : 
    1308           7 : static struct bpf_prog *bpf_prepare_filter(struct bpf_prog *fp,
    1309             :                                            bpf_aux_classic_check_t trans)
    1310             : {
    1311           7 :         int err;
    1312             : 
    1313           7 :         fp->bpf_func = NULL;
    1314           7 :         fp->jited = 0;
    1315             : 
    1316           7 :         err = bpf_check_classic(fp->insns, fp->len);
    1317           7 :         if (err) {
    1318           0 :                 __bpf_prog_release(fp);
    1319           0 :                 return ERR_PTR(err);
    1320             :         }
    1321             : 
    1322             :         /* There might be additional checks and transformations
    1323             :          * needed on classic filters, f.e. in case of seccomp.
    1324             :          */
    1325           7 :         if (trans) {
    1326           0 :                 err = trans(fp->insns, fp->len);
    1327           0 :                 if (err) {
    1328           0 :                         __bpf_prog_release(fp);
    1329           0 :                         return ERR_PTR(err);
    1330             :                 }
    1331             :         }
    1332             : 
    1333             :         /* Probe if we can JIT compile the filter and if so, do
    1334             :          * the compilation of the filter.
    1335             :          */
    1336           7 :         bpf_jit_compile(fp);
    1337             : 
    1338             :         /* JIT compiler couldn't process this filter, so do the
    1339             :          * internal BPF translation for the optimized interpreter.
    1340             :          */
    1341           7 :         if (!fp->jited)
    1342           7 :                 fp = bpf_migrate_filter(fp);
    1343             : 
    1344             :         return fp;
    1345             : }
    1346             : 
    1347             : /**
    1348             :  *      bpf_prog_create - create an unattached filter
    1349             :  *      @pfp: the unattached filter that is created
    1350             :  *      @fprog: the filter program
    1351             :  *
    1352             :  * Create a filter independent of any socket. We first run some
    1353             :  * sanity checks on it to make sure it does not explode on us later.
    1354             :  * If an error occurs or there is insufficient memory for the filter
    1355             :  * a negative errno code is returned. On success the return is zero.
    1356             :  */
    1357           0 : int bpf_prog_create(struct bpf_prog **pfp, struct sock_fprog_kern *fprog)
    1358             : {
    1359           0 :         unsigned int fsize = bpf_classic_proglen(fprog);
    1360           0 :         struct bpf_prog *fp;
    1361             : 
    1362             :         /* Make sure new filter is there and in the right amounts. */
    1363           0 :         if (!bpf_check_basics_ok(fprog->filter, fprog->len))
    1364             :                 return -EINVAL;
    1365             : 
    1366           0 :         fp = bpf_prog_alloc(bpf_prog_size(fprog->len), 0);
    1367           0 :         if (!fp)
    1368             :                 return -ENOMEM;
    1369             : 
    1370           0 :         memcpy(fp->insns, fprog->filter, fsize);
    1371             : 
    1372           0 :         fp->len = fprog->len;
    1373             :         /* Since unattached filters are not copied back to user
    1374             :          * space through sk_get_filter(), we do not need to hold
    1375             :          * a copy here, and can spare us the work.
    1376             :          */
    1377           0 :         fp->orig_prog = NULL;
    1378             :

    1514             : /**
    1515             :  *      sk_attach_filter - attach a socket filter
    1516             :  *      @fprog: the filter program
    1517             :  *      @sk: the socket to use
    1518             :  *
    1519             :  * Attach the user's filter code. We first run some sanity checks on
    1520             :  * it to make sure it does not explode on us later. If an error
    1521             :  * occurs or there is insufficient memory for the filter a negative
    1522             :  * errno code is returned. On success the return is zero.
    1523             :  */

    1526           7 :         struct bpf_prog *prog = __get_filter(fprog, sk);

    1530           0 :                 return PTR_ERR(prog);
    1531             :

    1533           7 :         if (err < 0) {
    1534           0 :                 __bpf_prog_release(prog);
    1535           0 :                 return err;
    1536             :         }
    1537             : 
    1538             :         return 0;

    1829           0 : BPF_CALL_2(bpf_skb_pull_data, struct sk_buff *, skb, u32, len)
    1830             : {
    1831             :         /* Idea is the following: should the needed direct read/write
    1832             :          * test fail during runtime, we can pull in more data and redo
    1833             :          * again, since implicitly, we invalidate previous checks here.
    1834             :          *
    1835             :          * Or, since we know how much we need to make read/writeable,
    1836             :          * this can be done once at the program beginning for direct
    1837             :          * access case. By this we overcome limitations of only current
    1838             :          * headroom being accessible.
    1839             :          */
    1840           0 :         return bpf_try_make_writable(skb, len ? : skb_headlen(skb));
    1841             : }

    1874             :         /* Idea is the following: should the needed direct read/write
    1875             :          * test fail during runtime, we can pull in more data and redo

    1877             :          *
    1878             :          * Or, since we know how much we need to make read/writeable,
    1879             :          * this can be done once at the program beginning for direct
    1880             :          * access case. By this we overcome limitations of only current
    1881             :          * headroom being accessible.

    1991           0 : BPF_CALL_5(bpf_csum_diff, __be32 *, from, u32, from_size,
    1992             :            __be32 *, to, u32, to_size, __wsum, seed)
    1993             : {
    1994           0 :         struct bpf_scratchpad *sp = this_cpu_ptr(&bpf_sp);
    1995           0 :         u32 diff_size = from_size + to_size;
    1996           0 :         int i, j = 0;
    1997             : 
    1998             :         /* This is quite flexible, some examples:
    1999             :          *
    2000             :          * from_size == 0, to_size > 0,  seed := csum --> pushing data
    2001             :          * from_size > 0,  to_size == 0, seed := csum --> pulling data
    2002             :          * from_size > 0,  to_size > 0,  seed := 0    --> diffing data
    2003             :          *
    2004             :          * Even for diffing, from_size and to_size don't need to be equal.
    2005             :          */
    2006           0 :         if (unlikely(((from_size | to_size) & (sizeof(__be32) - 1)) ||
    2007             :                      diff_size > sizeof(sp->diff)))
    2008             :                 return -EINVAL;
    2009             : 
    2010           0 :         for (i = 0; i < from_size / sizeof(__be32); i++, j++)
    2011           0 :                 sp->diff[j] = ~from[i];
    2012           0 :         for (i = 0; i <   to_size / sizeof(__be32); i++, j++)
    2013           0 :                 sp->diff[j] = to[i];
    2014             : 
    2015           0 :         return csum_partial(sp->diff, diff_size, seed);
    2016             : }
    2017             :

    2337           0 : static int __bpf_redirect_neigh_v4(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *dev,

    2358           0 :                         goto out_drop;
    2359           0 :                 if (rt->rt_type != RTN_UNICAST && rt->rt_type != RTN_LOCAL) {
    2360           0 :                         ip_rt_put(rt);
    2361           0 :                         goto out_drop;
    2362             :                 }
    2363             : 
    2364           0 :                 skb_dst_set(skb, &rt->dst);
    2365             :         }

    2369           0 :                 dev->stats.tx_errors++;
    2370             :         else
    2371             :                 ret = NET_XMIT_SUCCESS;
    2372           0 :         goto out_xmit;
    2373           0 : out_drop:
    2374           0 :         dev->stats.tx_errors++;
    2375           0 :         kfree_skb(skb);
    2376           0 : out_xmit:
    2377           0 :         return ret;
    2378             : }

    2388           0 : static int __bpf_redirect_neigh(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *dev,

    2390             : {
    2391           0 :         struct ethhdr *ethh = eth_hdr(skb);
    2392             : 
    2393           0 :         if (unlikely(skb->mac_header >= skb->network_header))
    2394           0 :                 goto out;
    2395           0 :         bpf_push_mac_rcsum(skb);
    2396           0 :         if (is_multicast_ether_addr(ethh->h_dest))
    2397           0 :                 goto out;
    2398             : 
    2399           0 :         skb_pull(skb, sizeof(*ethh));
    2400           0 :         skb_unset_mac_header(skb);
    2401           0 :         skb_reset_network_header(skb);
    2402             : 
    2403           0 :         if (skb->protocol == htons(ETH_P_IP))
    2404           0 :                 return __bpf_redirect_neigh_v4(skb, dev, nh);

    2408           0 :         kfree_skb(skb);
    2409           0 :         return -ENOTSUPP;

    2412             : /* Internal, non-exposed redirect flags. */

    2596           0 : BPF_CALL_4(bpf_msg_pull_data, struct sk_msg *, msg, u32, start,
    2597             :            u32, end, u64, flags)
    2598             : {
    2599           0 :         u32 len = 0, offset = 0, copy = 0, poffset = 0, bytes = end - start;
    2600           0 :         u32 first_sge, last_sge, i, shift, bytes_sg_total;
    2601           0 :         struct scatterlist *sge;
    2602           0 :         u8 *raw, *to, *from;
    2603           0 :         struct page *page;
    2604             : 
    2605           0 :         if (unlikely(flags || end <= start))
    2606             :                 return -EINVAL;
    2607             : 
    2608             :         /* First find the starting scatterlist element */
    2609           0 :         i = msg->sg.start;
    2610           0 :         do {
    2611           0 :                 offset += len;
    2612           0 :                 len = sk_msg_elem(msg, i)->length;
    2613           0 :                 if (start < offset + len)
    2614             :                         break;
    2615           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2616           0 :         } while (i != msg->sg.end);
    2617             : 
    2618           0 :         if (unlikely(start >= offset + len))
    2619             :                 return -EINVAL;
    2620             : 
    2621           0 :         first_sge = i;
    2622             :         /* The start may point into the sg element so we need to also
    2623             :          * account for the headroom.
    2624             :          */
    2625           0 :         bytes_sg_total = start - offset + bytes;
    2626           0 :         if (!test_bit(i, &msg->sg.copy) && bytes_sg_total <= len)
    2627           0 :                 goto out;
    2628             : 
    2629             :         /* At this point we need to linearize multiple scatterlist
    2630             :          * elements or a single shared page. Either way we need to
    2631             :          * copy into a linear buffer exclusively owned by BPF. Then
    2632             :          * place the buffer in the scatterlist and fixup the original
    2633             :          * entries by removing the entries now in the linear buffer
    2634             :          * and shifting the remaining entries. For now we do not try
    2635             :          * to copy partial entries to avoid complexity of running out
    2636             :          * of sg_entry slots. The downside is reading a single byte
    2637             :          * will copy the entire sg entry.
    2638             :          */
    2639           0 :         do {
    2640           0 :                 copy += sk_msg_elem(msg, i)->length;
    2641           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2642           0 :                 if (bytes_sg_total <= copy)
    2643             :                         break;
    2644           0 :         } while (i != msg->sg.end);
    2645           0 :         last_sge = i;
    2646             : 
    2647           0 :         if (unlikely(bytes_sg_total > copy))
    2648             :                 return -EINVAL;
    2649             : 
    2650           0 :         page = alloc_pages(__GFP_NOWARN | GFP_ATOMIC | __GFP_COMP,
    2651           0 :                            get_order(copy));
    2652           0 :         if (unlikely(!page))
    2653             :                 return -ENOMEM;
    2654             : 
    2655           0 :         raw = page_address(page);
    2656           0 :         i = first_sge;
    2657           0 :         do {
    2658           0 :                 sge = sk_msg_elem(msg, i);
    2659           0 :                 from = sg_virt(sge);
    2660           0 :                 len = sge->length;
    2661           0 :                 to = raw + poffset;
    2662             : 
    2663           0 :                 memcpy(to, from, len);
    2664           0 :                 poffset += len;
    2665           0 :                 sge->length = 0;
    2666           0 :                 put_page(sg_page(sge));
    2667             : 
    2668           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2669           0 :         } while (i != last_sge);
    2670             : 
    2671           0 :         sg_set_page(&msg->sg.data[first_sge], page, copy, 0);
    2672             : 
    2673             :         /* To repair sg ring we need to shift entries. If we only
    2674             :          * had a single entry though we can just replace it and
    2675             :          * be done. Otherwise walk the ring and shift the entries.
    2676             :          */
    2677           0 :         WARN_ON_ONCE(last_sge == first_sge);
    2678           0 :         shift = last_sge > first_sge ?
    2679           0 :                 last_sge - first_sge - 1 :
    2680           0 :                 NR_MSG_FRAG_IDS - first_sge + last_sge - 1;
    2681           0 :         if (!shift)
    2682           0 :                 goto out;
    2683             : 
    2684           0 :         i = first_sge;
    2685           0 :         sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2686           0 :         do {
    2687           0 :                 u32 move_from;
    2688             : 
    2689           0 :                 if (i + shift >= NR_MSG_FRAG_IDS)
    2690           0 :                         move_from = i + shift - NR_MSG_FRAG_IDS;
    2691             :                 else
    2692             :                         move_from = i + shift;
    2693           0 :                 if (move_from == msg->sg.end)
    2694             :                         break;
    2695             : 
    2696           0 :                 msg->sg.data[i] = msg->sg.data[move_from];
    2697           0 :                 msg->sg.data[move_from].length = 0;
    2698           0 :                 msg->sg.data[move_from].page_link = 0;
    2699           0 :                 msg->sg.data[move_from].offset = 0;
    2700           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2701             :         } while (1);
    2702             : 
    2703           0 :         msg->sg.end = msg->sg.end - shift > msg->sg.end ?
    2704           0 :                       msg->sg.end - shift + NR_MSG_FRAG_IDS :
    2705             :                       msg->sg.end - shift;
    2706           0 : out:
    2707           0 :         msg->data = sg_virt(&msg->sg.data[first_sge]) + start - offset;
    2708           0 :         msg->data_end = msg->data + bytes;
    2709           0 :         return 0;
    2710             : }

    2712             : static const struct bpf_func_proto bpf_msg_pull_data_proto = {
    2713             :         .func           = bpf_msg_pull_data,
    2714             :         .gpl_only       = false,

    2722           0 : BPF_CALL_4(bpf_msg_push_data, struct sk_msg *, msg, u32, start,
    2723             :            u32, len, u64, flags)
    2724             : {
    2725           0 :         struct scatterlist sge, nsge, nnsge, rsge = {0}, *psge;
    2726           0 :         u32 new, i = 0, l = 0, space, copy = 0, offset = 0;
    2727           0 :         u8 *raw, *to, *from;
    2728           0 :         struct page *page;
    2729             : 
    2730           0 :         if (unlikely(flags))
    2731             :                 return -EINVAL;
    2732             : 
    2733             :         /* First find the starting scatterlist element */
    2734           0 :         i = msg->sg.start;
    2735           0 :         do {
    2736           0 :                 offset += l;
    2737           0 :                 l = sk_msg_elem(msg, i)->length;
    2738             : 
    2739           0 :                 if (start < offset + l)
    2740             :                         break;
    2741           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2742           0 :         } while (i != msg->sg.end);
    2743             : 
    2744           0 :         if (start >= offset + l)
    2745             :                 return -EINVAL;
    2746             : 
    2747           0 :         space = MAX_MSG_FRAGS - sk_msg_elem_used(msg);
    2748             : 
    2749             :         /* If no space available will fallback to copy, we need at
    2750             :          * least one scatterlist elem available to push data into
    2751             :          * when start aligns to the beginning of an element or two
    2752             :          * when it falls inside an element. We handle the start equals
    2753             :          * offset case because its the common case for inserting a
    2754             :          * header.
    2755             :          */
    2756           0 :         if (!space || (space == 1 && start != offset))
    2757           0 :                 copy = msg->sg.data[i].length;
    2758             : 
    2759           0 :         page = alloc_pages(__GFP_NOWARN | GFP_ATOMIC | __GFP_COMP,
    2760           0 :                            get_order(copy + len));
    2761           0 :         if (unlikely(!page))
    2762             :                 return -ENOMEM;
    2763             : 
    2764           0 :         if (copy) {
    2765           0 :                 int front, back;
    2766             : 
    2767           0 :                 raw = page_address(page);
    2768             : 
    2769           0 :                 psge = sk_msg_elem(msg, i);
    2770           0 :                 front = start - offset;
    2771           0 :                 back = psge->length - front;
    2772           0 :                 from = sg_virt(psge);
    2773             : 
    2774           0 :                 if (front)
    2775           0 :                         memcpy(raw, from, front);
    2776             : 
    2777           0 :                 if (back) {
    2778           0 :                         from += front;
    2779           0 :                         to = raw + front + len;
    2780             : 
    2781           0 :                         memcpy(to, from, back);
    2782             :                 }
    2783             : 
    2784           0 :                 put_page(sg_page(psge));
    2785           0 :         } else if (start - offset) {
    2786           0 :                 psge = sk_msg_elem(msg, i);
    2787           0 :                 rsge = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2788             : 
    2789           0 :                 psge->length = start - offset;
    2790           0 :                 rsge.length -= psge->length;
    2791           0 :                 rsge.offset += start;
    2792             : 
    2793           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2794           0 :                 sg_unmark_end(psge);
    2795           0 :                 sg_unmark_end(&rsge);
    2796           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_next(msg, end);
    2797             :         }
    2798             : 
    2799             :         /* Slot(s) to place newly allocated data */
    2800           0 :         new = i;
    2801             : 
    2802             :         /* Shift one or two slots as needed */
    2803           0 :         if (!copy) {
    2804           0 :                 sge = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2805             : 
    2806           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2807           0 :                 sg_unmark_end(&sge);
    2808           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_next(msg, end);
    2809             : 
    2810           0 :                 nsge = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2811           0 :                 if (rsge.length) {
    2812           0 :                         sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2813           0 :                         nnsge = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2814             :                 }
    2815             : 
    2816           0 :                 while (i != msg->sg.end) {
    2817           0 :                         msg->sg.data[i] = sge;
    2818           0 :                         sge = nsge;
    2819           0 :                         sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2820           0 :                         if (rsge.length) {
    2821           0 :                                 nsge = nnsge;
    2822           0 :                                 nnsge = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2823             :                         } else {
    2824           0 :                                 nsge = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2825             :                         }
    2826             :                 }
    2827             :         }
    2828             : 
    2829             :         /* Place newly allocated data buffer */
    2830           0 :         sk_mem_charge(msg->sk, len);
    2831           0 :         msg->sg.size += len;
    2832           0 :         __clear_bit(new, &msg->sg.copy);
    2833           0 :         sg_set_page(&msg->sg.data[new], page, len + copy, 0);
    2834           0 :         if (rsge.length) {
    2835           0 :                 get_page(sg_page(&rsge));
    2836           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(new);
    2837           0 :                 msg->sg.data[new] = rsge;
    2838             :         }
    2839             : 
    2840           0 :         sk_msg_compute_data_pointers(msg);
    2841           0 :         return 0;
    2842             : }
    2843             : 
    2844             : static const struct bpf_func_proto bpf_msg_push_data_proto = {
