    2854           0 : static void sk_msg_shift_left(struct sk_msg *msg, int i)
    2855             : {
    2856           0 :         int prev;
    2857             : 
    2858           0 :         do {
    2859           0 :                 prev = i;
    2860           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2861           0 :                 msg->sg.data[prev] = msg->sg.data[i];
    2862           0 :         } while (i != msg->sg.end);
    2863             : 
    2864           0 :         sk_msg_iter_prev(msg, end);
    2865           0 : }
    2866             : 
    2867           0 : static void sk_msg_shift_right(struct sk_msg *msg, int i)
    2868             : {
    2869           0 :         struct scatterlist tmp, sge;
    2870             : 
    2871           0 :         sk_msg_iter_next(msg, end);
    2872           0 :         sge = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2873           0 :         sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2874           0 :         tmp = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2875             : 
    2876           0 :         while (i != msg->sg.end) {
    2877           0 :                 msg->sg.data[i] = sge;
    2878           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2879           0 :                 sge = tmp;
    2880           0 :                 tmp = sk_msg_elem_cpy(msg, i);
    2881             :         }

    2884           0 : BPF_CALL_4(bpf_msg_pop_data, struct sk_msg *, msg, u32, start,
    2885             :            u32, len, u64, flags)
    2886             : {
    2887           0 :         u32 i = 0, l = 0, space, offset = 0;
    2888           0 :         u64 last = start + len;
    2889           0 :         int pop;
    2890             : 
    2891           0 :         if (unlikely(flags))
    2892             :                 return -EINVAL;
    2893             : 
    2894             :         /* First find the starting scatterlist element */
    2895           0 :         i = msg->sg.start;
    2896           0 :         do {
    2897           0 :                 offset += l;
    2898           0 :                 l = sk_msg_elem(msg, i)->length;
    2899             : 
    2900           0 :                 if (start < offset + l)
    2901             :                         break;
    2902           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2903           0 :         } while (i != msg->sg.end);
    2904             : 
    2905             :         /* Bounds checks: start and pop must be inside message */
    2906           0 :         if (start >= offset + l || last >= msg->sg.size)
    2907             :                 return -EINVAL;
    2908             : 
    2909           0 :         space = MAX_MSG_FRAGS - sk_msg_elem_used(msg);
    2910             : 
    2911           0 :         pop = len;
    2912             :         /* --------------| offset
    2913             :          * -| start      |-------- len -------|
    2914             :          *
    2915             :          *  |----- a ----|-------- pop -------|----- b ----|
    2916             :          *  |______________________________________________| length
    2917             :          *
    2918             :          *
    2919             :          * a:   region at front of scatter element to save
    2920             :          * b:   region at back of scatter element to save when length > A + pop
    2921             :          * pop: region to pop from element, same as input 'pop' here will be
    2922             :          *      decremented below per iteration.
    2923             :          *
    2924             :          * Two top-level cases to handle when start != offset, first B is non
    2925             :          * zero and second B is zero corresponding to when a pop includes more
    2926             :          * than one element.
    2927             :          *
    2928             :          * Then if B is non-zero AND there is no space allocate space and
    2929             :          * compact A, B regions into page. If there is space shift ring to
    2930             :          * the rigth free'ing the next element in ring to place B, leaving
    2931             :          * A untouched except to reduce length.
    2932             :          */
    2933           0 :         if (start != offset) {
    2934           0 :                 struct scatterlist *nsge, *sge = sk_msg_elem(msg, i);
    2935           0 :                 int a = start;
    2936           0 :                 int b = sge->length - pop - a;
    2937             : 
    2938           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    2939             : 
    2940           0 :                 if (pop < sge->length - a) {
    2941           0 :                         if (space) {
    2942           0 :                                 sge->length = a;
    2943           0 :                                 sk_msg_shift_right(msg, i);
    2944           0 :                                 nsge = sk_msg_elem(msg, i);
    2945           0 :                                 get_page(sg_page(sge));
    2946           0 :                                 sg_set_page(nsge,
    2947             :                                             sg_page(sge),
    2948           0 :                                             b, sge->offset + pop + a);
    2949             :                         } else {
    2950           0 :                                 struct page *page, *orig;
    2951           0 :                                 u8 *to, *from;
    2952             : 
    2953           0 :                                 page = alloc_pages(__GFP_NOWARN |
    2954             :                                                    __GFP_COMP   | GFP_ATOMIC,
    2955           0 :                                                    get_order(a + b));
    2956           0 :                                 if (unlikely(!page))
    2957             :                                         return -ENOMEM;
    2958             : 
    2959           0 :                                 sge->length = a;
    2960           0 :                                 orig = sg_page(sge);
    2961           0 :                                 from = sg_virt(sge);
    2962           0 :                                 to = page_address(page);
    2963           0 :                                 memcpy(to, from, a);
    2964           0 :                                 memcpy(to + a, from + a + pop, b);
    2965           0 :                                 sg_set_page(sge, page, a + b, 0);
    2966           0 :                                 put_page(orig);
    2967             :                         }
    2968             :                         pop = 0;
    2969           0 :                 } else if (pop >= sge->length - a) {
    2970           0 :                         pop -= (sge->length - a);
    2971           0 :                         sge->length = a;
    2972             :                 }
    2973             :         }
    2974             : 
    2975             :         /* From above the current layout _must_ be as follows,
    2976             :          *
    2977             :          * -| offset
    2978             :          * -| start
    2979             :          *
    2980             :          *  |---- pop ---|---------------- b ------------|
    2981             :          *  |____________________________________________| length
    2982             :          *
    2983             :          * Offset and start of the current msg elem are equal because in the
    2984             :          * previous case we handled offset != start and either consumed the
    2985             :          * entire element and advanced to the next element OR pop == 0.
    2986             :          *
    2987             :          * Two cases to handle here are first pop is less than the length
    2988             :          * leaving some remainder b above. Simply adjust the element's layout
    2989             :          * in this case. Or pop >= length of the element so that b = 0. In this
    2990             :          * case advance to next element decrementing pop.
    2991             :          */
    2992           0 :         while (pop) {
    2993           0 :                 struct scatterlist *sge = sk_msg_elem(msg, i);
    2994             : 
    2995           0 :                 if (pop < sge->length) {
    2996           0 :                         sge->length -= pop;
    2997           0 :                         sge->offset += pop;
    2998           0 :                         pop = 0;
    2999             :                 } else {
    3000           0 :                         pop -= sge->length;
    3001           0 :                         sk_msg_shift_left(msg, i);
    3002             :                 }
    3003           0 :                 sk_msg_iter_var_next(i);
    3004             :         }
    3005             : 
    3006           0 :         sk_mem_uncharge(msg->sk, len - pop);
    3007           0 :         msg->sg.size -= (len - pop);
    3008           0 :         sk_msg_compute_data_pointers(msg);
    3009           0 :         return 0;
    3010             : }
    3011             :

    3326             :

    3329           0 :                 return bpf_skb_proto_4_to_6(skb);
    3330             : 
    3331           0 :         if (from_proto == htons(ETH_P_IPV6) &&
    3332           0 :               to_proto == htons(ETH_P_IP))
    3333           0 :                 return bpf_skb_proto_6_to_4(skb);
    3334             : 
    3335             :         return -ENOTSUPP;
    3336             : }
    3337             : 
    3338           0 : BPF_CALL_3(bpf_skb_change_proto, struct sk_buff *, skb, __be16, proto,
    3339             :            u64, flags)
    3340             : {
    3341           0 :         int ret;
    3342             : 
    3343           0 :         if (unlikely(flags))
    3344             :                 return -EINVAL;
    3345             : 
    3346             :         /* General idea is that this helper does the basic groundwork
    3347             :          * needed for changing the protocol, and eBPF program fills the
    3348             :          * rest through bpf_skb_store_bytes(), bpf_lX_csum_replace()
    3349             :          * and other helpers, rather than passing a raw buffer here.
    3350             :          *
    3351             :          * The rationale is to keep this minimal and without a need to
    3352             :          * deal with raw packet data. F.e. even if we would pass buffers
    3353             :          * here, the program still needs to call the bpf_lX_csum_replace()
    3354             :          * helpers anyway. Plus, this way we keep also separation of
    3355             :          * concerns, since f.e. bpf_skb_store_bytes() should only take
    3356             :          * care of stores.
    3357             :          *
    3358             :          * Currently, additional options and extension header space are
    3359             :          * not supported, but flags register is reserved so we can adapt
    3360             :          * that. For offloads, we mark packet as dodgy, so that headers
    3361             :          * need to be verified first.
    3362             :          */
    3363           0 :         ret = bpf_skb_proto_xlat(skb, proto);
    3364           0 :         bpf_compute_data_pointers(skb);
    3365           0 :         return ret;
    3366             : }
    3367             :

    3372             :         .arg1_type      = ARG_PTR_TO_CTX,
    3373             :         .arg2_type      = ARG_ANYTHING,

    3418           0 : static int bpf_skb_net_grow(struct sk_buff *skb, u32 off, u32 len_diff,
    3419             :                             u64 flags)
    3420             : {
    3421           0 :         u8 inner_mac_len = flags >> BPF_ADJ_ROOM_ENCAP_L2_SHIFT;
    3422           0 :         bool encap = flags & BPF_F_ADJ_ROOM_ENCAP_L3_MASK;
    3423           0 :         u16 mac_len = 0, inner_net = 0, inner_trans = 0;
    3424           0 :         unsigned int gso_type = SKB_GSO_DODGY;
    3425           0 :         int ret;
    3426             : 
    3427           0 :         if (skb_is_gso(skb) && !skb_is_gso_tcp(skb)) {
    3428             :                 /* udp gso_size delineates datagrams, only allow if fixed */
    3429           0 :                 if (!(skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_type & SKB_GSO_UDP_L4) ||
    3430           0 :                     !(flags & BPF_F_ADJ_ROOM_FIXED_GSO))
    3431             :                         return -ENOTSUPP;
    3432             :         }
    3433             : 
    3434           0 :         ret = skb_cow_head(skb, len_diff);

    3438           0 :         if (encap) {

    3458           0 :                 inner_trans = skb->transport_header;

    3599           0 : BPF_CALL_4(bpf_skb_adjust_room, struct sk_buff *, skb, s32, len_diff,

    3602           0 :         u32 len_cur, len_diff_abs = abs(len_diff);

    3625             :                 break;

    3668           0 : static int bpf_skb_grow_rcsum(struct sk_buff *skb, unsigned int new_len)
    3669             : {
    3670           0 :         unsigned int old_len = skb->len;
    3671           0 :         int ret;
    3672             : 
    3673           0 :         ret = __skb_grow_rcsum(skb, new_len);
    3674           0 :         if (!ret)
    3675           0 :                 memset(skb->data + old_len, 0, new_len - old_len);
    3676           0 :         return ret;
    3677             : }

    3679           0 : static int bpf_skb_trim_rcsum(struct sk_buff *skb, unsigned int new_len)
    3680             : {
    3681           0 :         return __skb_trim_rcsum(skb, new_len);

    3683             : 
    3684           0 : static inline int __bpf_skb_change_tail(struct sk_buff *skb, u32 new_len,
    3685             :                                         u64 flags)
    3686             : {
    3687           0 :         u32 max_len = BPF_SKB_MAX_LEN;
    3688           0 :         u32 min_len = __bpf_skb_min_len(skb);
    3689           0 :         int ret;
    3690             : 
    3691           0 :         if (unlikely(flags || new_len > max_len || new_len < min_len))
    3692             :                 return -EINVAL;
    3693           0 :         if (skb->encapsulation)
    3694             :                 return -ENOTSUPP;
    3695             : 
    3696             :         /* The basic idea of this helper is that it's performing the
    3697             :          * needed work to either grow or trim an skb, and eBPF program
    3698             :          * rewrites the rest via helpers like bpf_skb_store_bytes(),
    3699             :          * bpf_lX_csum_replace() and others rather than passing a raw
    3700             :          * buffer here. This one is a slow path helper and intended
    3701             :          * for replies with control messages.
    3702             :          *
    3703             :          * Like in bpf_skb_change_proto(), we want to keep this rather
    3704             :          * minimal and without protocol specifics so that we are able
    3705             :          * to separate concerns as in bpf_skb_store_bytes() should only
    3706             :          * be the one responsible for writing buffers.
    3707             :          *
    3708             :          * It's really expected to be a slow path operation here for
    3709             :          * control message replies, so we're implicitly linearizing,
    3710             :          * uncloning and drop offloads from the skb by this.
    3711             :          */
    3712           0 :         ret = __bpf_try_make_writable(skb, skb->len);
    3713           0 :         if (!ret) {
    3714           0 :                 if (new_len > skb->len)
    3715           0 :                         ret = bpf_skb_grow_rcsum(skb, new_len);
    3716           0 :                 else if (new_len < skb->len)
    3717           0 :                         ret = bpf_skb_trim_rcsum(skb, new_len);
    3718           0 :                 if (!ret && skb_is_gso(skb))
    3719           0 :                         skb_gso_reset(skb);
    3720             :         }
    3721             :         return ret;
    3722             : }
    3723             : 
    3724           0 : BPF_CALL_3(bpf_skb_change_tail, struct sk_buff *, skb, u32, new_len,
    3725             :            u64, flags)
    3726             : {
    3727           0 :         int ret = __bpf_skb_change_tail(skb, new_len, flags);
    3728             : 
    3729           0 :         bpf_compute_data_pointers(skb);
    3730           0 :         return ret;
    3731             : }
    3732             : 
    3733             : static const struct bpf_func_proto bpf_skb_change_tail_proto = {
    3734             :         .func           = bpf_skb_change_tail,
    3735             :         .gpl_only       = false,
    3736             :         .ret_type       = RET_INTEGER,
    3737             :         .arg1_type      = ARG_PTR_TO_CTX,
    3738             :         .arg2_type      = ARG_ANYTHING,
    3739             :         .arg3_type      = ARG_ANYTHING,
    3740             : };
    3741             : 
    3742           0 : BPF_CALL_3(sk_skb_change_tail, struct sk_buff *, skb, u32, new_len,
    3743             :            u64, flags)
    3744             : {
    3745           0 :         int ret = __bpf_skb_change_tail(skb, new_len, flags);
    3746             : 
    3747           0 :         bpf_compute_data_end_sk_skb(skb);
    3748           0 :         return ret;
    3749             : }
    3750             : 
    3751             : static const struct bpf_func_proto sk_skb_change_tail_proto = {
    3752             :         .func           = sk_skb_change_tail,
    3753             :         .gpl_only       = false,
    3754             :         .ret_type       = RET_INTEGER,
    3755             :         .arg1_type      = ARG_PTR_TO_CTX,
    3756             :         .arg2_type      = ARG_ANYTHING,
    3757             :         .arg3_type      = ARG_ANYTHING,
    3758             : };
    3759             : 
    3760           0 : static inline int __bpf_skb_change_head(struct sk_buff *skb, u32 head_room,
    3761             :                                         u64 flags)
    3762             : {
    3763           0 :         u32 max_len = BPF_SKB_MAX_LEN;
    3764           0 :         u32 new_len = skb->len + head_room;
    3765           0 :         int ret;
    3766             : 
    3767           0 :         if (unlikely(flags || (!skb_is_gso(skb) && new_len > max_len) ||
    3768             :                      new_len < skb->len))
    3769             :                 return -EINVAL;
    3770             : 
    3771           0 :         ret = skb_cow(skb, head_room);
    3772           0 :         if (likely(!ret)) {
    3773             :                 /* Idea for this helper is that we currently only
    3774             :                  * allow to expand on mac header. This means that
    3775             :                  * skb->protocol network header, etc, stay as is.
    3776             :                  * Compared to bpf_skb_change_tail(), we're more
    3777             :                  * flexible due to not needing to linearize or
    3778             :                  * reset GSO. Intention for this helper is to be
    3779             :                  * used by an L3 skb that needs to push mac header
    3780             :                  * for redirection into L2 device.
    3781             :                  */
    3782           0 :                 __skb_push(skb, head_room);
    3783           0 :                 memset(skb->data, 0, head_room);
    3784           0 :                 skb_reset_mac_header(skb);
    3785             :         }
    3786             : 
    3787             :         return ret;
    3788             : }
    3789             :

    5624             :

    5650           0 : BPF_CALL_5(bpf_skb_check_mtu, struct sk_buff *, skb,
    5651             :            u32, ifindex, u32 *, mtu_len, s32, len_diff, u64, flags)
    5652             : {
    5653           0 :         int ret = BPF_MTU_CHK_RET_FRAG_NEEDED;
    5654           0 :         struct net_device *dev = skb->dev;
    5655           0 :         int skb_len, dev_len;
    5656           0 :         int mtu;
    5657             : 
    5658           0 :         if (unlikely(flags & ~(BPF_MTU_CHK_SEGS)))
    5659             :                 return -EINVAL;
    5660             : 
    5661           0 :         if (unlikely(flags & BPF_MTU_CHK_SEGS && len_diff))
    5662             :                 return -EINVAL;
    5663             : 
    5664           0 :         dev = __dev_via_ifindex(dev, ifindex);
    5665           0 :         if (unlikely(!dev))
    5666             :                 return -ENODEV;
    5667             : 
    5668           0 :         mtu = READ_ONCE(dev->mtu);
    5669             : 
    5670           0 :         dev_len = mtu + dev->hard_header_len;
    5671           0 :         skb_len = skb->len + len_diff; /* minus result pass check */
    5672           0 :         if (skb_len <= dev_len) {
    5673           0 :                 ret = BPF_MTU_CHK_RET_SUCCESS;
    5674           0 :                 goto out;
    5675             :         }
    5676             :         /* At this point, skb->len exceed MTU, but as it include length of all
    5677             :          * segments, it can still be below MTU.  The SKB can possibly get
    5678             :          * re-segmented in transmit path (see validate_xmit_skb).  Thus, user
    5679             :          * must choose if segs are to be MTU checked.
    5680             :          */
    5681           0 :         if (skb_is_gso(skb)) {
    5682           0 :                 ret = BPF_MTU_CHK_RET_SUCCESS;
    5683             : 
    5684           0 :                 if (flags & BPF_MTU_CHK_SEGS &&
    5685           0 :                     !skb_gso_validate_network_len(skb, mtu))
    5686           0 :                         ret = BPF_MTU_CHK_RET_SEGS_TOOBIG;
    5687             :         }
    5688           0 : out:
    5689             :         /* BPF verifier guarantees valid pointer */
    5690           0 :         *mtu_len = mtu;
    5691             : 
    5692           0 :         return ret;
    5693             : }

    5695           0 : BPF_CALL_5(bpf_xdp_check_mtu, struct xdp_buff *, xdp,

    5974             : BPF_CALL_3(bpf_lwt_seg6_adjust_srh, struct sk_buff *, skb, u32, offset,
    5975             :            s32, len)
    5976             : {
    5977             :         struct seg6_bpf_srh_state *srh_state =
    5978             :                 this_cpu_ptr(&seg6_bpf_srh_states);
    5979             :         struct ipv6_sr_hdr *srh = srh_state->srh;
    5980             :         void *srh_end, *srh_tlvs, *ptr;

    5984             : 
    5985             :         if (unlikely(srh == NULL))
    5986             :                 return -EINVAL;
    5987             : 
    5988             :         srh_tlvs = (void *)((unsigned char *)srh + sizeof(*srh) +
    5989             :                         ((srh->first_segment + 1) << 4));
    5990             :         srh_end = (void *)((unsigned char *)srh + sizeof(*srh) +
    5991             :                         srh_state->hdrlen);
    5992             :         ptr = skb->data + offset;
    5993             : 
    5994             :         if (unlikely(ptr < srh_tlvs || ptr > srh_end))
    5995             :                 return -EFAULT;

    5997             :                 return -EFAULT;
    5998             :

    6002             :                         return ret;
    6003             : 
    6004             :                 ret = bpf_skb_net_hdr_push(skb, offset, len);
    6005             :         } else {
    6006             :                 ret = bpf_skb_net_hdr_pop(skb, offset, -1 * len);
    6007             :         }
    6008             : 
    6009             :         bpf_compute_data_pointers(skb);

    6011             :                 return ret;
    6012             : 
    6013             :         hdr = (struct ipv6hdr *)skb->data;

    6015             : 
    6016             :         if (ipv6_find_hdr(skb, &srhoff, IPPROTO_ROUTING, NULL, NULL) < 0)
    6017             :                 return -EINVAL;
    6018             :         srh_state->srh = (struct ipv6_sr_hdr *)(skb->data + srhoff);
    6019             :         srh_state->hdrlen += len;
    6020             :         srh_state->valid = false;
    6021             :         return 0;
    6022             : }

    6034             : #ifdef CONFIG_INET
    6035           0 : static struct sock *sk_lookup(struct net *net, struct bpf_sock_tuple *tuple,
    6036             :                               int dif, int sdif, u8 family, u8 proto)
    6037             : {
    6038           0 :         bool refcounted = false;
    6039           0 :         struct sock *sk = NULL;
    6040             : 
    6041           0 :         if (family == AF_INET) {
    6042           0 :                 __be32 src4 = tuple->ipv4.saddr;
    6043           0 :                 __be32 dst4 = tuple->ipv4.daddr;
    6044             : 
    6045           0 :                 if (proto == IPPROTO_TCP)
    6046           0 :                         sk = __inet_lookup(net, &tcp_hashinfo, NULL, 0,
    6047           0 :                                            src4, tuple->ipv4.sport,
    6048           0 :                                            dst4, tuple->ipv4.dport,
    6049             :                                            dif, sdif, &refcounted);
    6050             :                 else
    6051           0 :                         sk = __udp4_lib_lookup(net, src4, tuple->ipv4.sport,
    6052           0 :                                                dst4, tuple->ipv4.dport,
    6053             :                                                dif, sdif, &udp_table, NULL);
    6054             : #if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_IPV6)
    6055             :         } else {
    6056             :                 struct in6_addr *src6 = (struct in6_addr *)&tuple->ipv6.saddr;
    6057             :                 struct in6_addr *dst6 = (struct in6_addr *)&tuple->ipv6.daddr;
    6058             : 
    6059             :                 if (proto == IPPROTO_TCP)
    6060             :                         sk = __inet6_lookup(net, &tcp_hashinfo, NULL, 0,
    6061             :                                             src6, tuple->ipv6.sport,
    6062             :                                             dst6, ntohs(tuple->ipv6.dport),
    6063             :                                             dif, sdif, &refcounted);
    6064             :                 else if (likely(ipv6_bpf_stub))
    6065             :                         sk = ipv6_bpf_stub->udp6_lib_lookup(net,
    6066             :                                                             src6, tuple->ipv6.sport,
    6067             :                                                             dst6, tuple->ipv6.dport,
    6068             :                                                             dif, sdif,
    6069             :                                                             &udp_table, NULL);
    6070             : #endif
    6071             :         }
    6072             : 
    6073           0 :         if (unlikely(sk && !refcounted && !sock_flag(sk, SOCK_RCU_FREE))) {

    6079             : 
    6080             : /* bpf_skc_lookup performs the core lookup for different types of sockets,
    6081             :  * taking a reference on the socket if it doesn't have the flag SOCK_RCU_FREE.
    6082             :  * Returns the socket as an 'unsigned long' to simplify the casting in the
    6083             :  * callers to satisfy BPF_CALL declarations.

    6835           0 : BPF_CALL_4(bpf_sock_ops_load_hdr_opt, struct bpf_sock_ops_kern *, bpf_sock,

    6840           0 :         u8 search_kind, search_len, copy_len, magic_len;
    6841           0 :         int ret;
    6842             : 
    6843             :         /* 2 byte is the minimal option len except TCPOPT_NOP and
    6844             :          * TCPOPT_EOL which are useless for the bpf prog to learn
    6845             :          * and this helper disallow loading them also.
    6846             :          */
    6847           0 :         if (len < 2 || flags & ~BPF_LOAD_HDR_OPT_TCP_SYN)

    6935           0 :         if (new_kind_len > bpf_sock->remaining_opt_len)
    6936             :                 return -ENOSPC;
    6937             : 
    6938             :         /* 253 is another experimental kind */
    6939           0 :         if (new_kind == TCPOPT_EXP || new_kind == 253)  {
    6940           0 :                 if (new_kind_len < 4)
    6941             :                         return -EINVAL;
    6942             :                 /* Match for the 2 byte magic also.
    6943             :                  * RFC 6994: the magic could be 2 or 4 bytes.
    6944             :                  * Hence, matching by 2 byte only is on the
    6945             :                  * conservative side but it is the right
    6946             :                  * thing to do for the 'search-for-duplication'
    6947             :                  * purpose.
    6948             :                  */
    6949           0 :                 magic = &new_op[2];
    6950           0 :                 magic_len = 2;
    6951             :         }
    6952             : 
    6953             :         /* Check for duplication */
    6954           0 :         skb = bpf_sock->skb;
    6955           0 :         op = skb->data + sizeof(struct tcphdr);
    6956           0 :         opend = bpf_sock->skb_data_end;

    6958           0 :         op = bpf_search_tcp_opt(op, opend, new_kind, magic, magic_len,
    6959             :                                 &eol);
    6960           0 :         if (!IS_ERR(op))
    6961             :                 return -EEXIST;
    6962             : 
    6963           0 :         if (PTR_ERR(op) != -ENOMSG)
    6964           0 :                 return PTR_ERR(op);
    6965             : 
    6966           0 :         if (eol)
    6967             :                 /* The option has been ended.  Treat it as no more
    6968             :                  * header option can be written.
    6969             :                  */
    6970             :                 return -ENOSPC;
    6971             : 
    6972             :         /* No duplication found.  Store the header option. */

    7662           0 : static bool bpf_skb_is_valid_access(int off, int size, enum bpf_access_type type,
    7663             :                                     const struct bpf_prog *prog,
    7664             :                                     struct bpf_insn_access_aux *info)
    7665             : {
    7666           0 :         const int size_default = sizeof(__u32);
    7667             : 
    7668           0 :         if (off < 0 || off >= sizeof(struct __sk_buff))
    7669             :                 return false;
    7670             : 
    7671             :         /* The verifier guarantees that size > 0. */
    7672           0 :         if (off % size != 0)
    7673             :                 return false;
    7674             : 
    7675           0 :         switch (off) {
    7676           0 :         case bpf_ctx_range_till(struct __sk_buff, cb[0], cb[4]):
    7677           0 :                 if (off + size > offsetofend(struct __sk_buff, cb[4]))
    7678           0 :                         return false;
    7679             :                 break;
    7680           0 :         case bpf_ctx_range_till(struct __sk_buff, remote_ip6[0], remote_ip6[3]):
    7681             :         case bpf_ctx_range_till(struct __sk_buff, local_ip6[0], local_ip6[3]):
    7682             :         case bpf_ctx_range_till(struct __sk_buff, remote_ip4, remote_ip4):
    7683             :         case bpf_ctx_range_till(struct __sk_buff, local_ip4, local_ip4):
    7684             :         case bpf_ctx_range(struct __sk_buff, data):
    7685             :         case bpf_ctx_range(struct __sk_buff, data_meta):
    7686             :         case bpf_ctx_range(struct __sk_buff, data_end):
    7687           0 :                 if (size != size_default)
    7688           0 :                         return false;
    7689             :                 break;
    7690             :         case bpf_ctx_range_ptr(struct __sk_buff, flow_keys):
    7691             :                 return false;
    7692           0 :         case bpf_ctx_range(struct __sk_buff, tstamp):
    7693           0 :                 if (size != sizeof(__u64))
    7694           0 :                         return false;
    7695             :                 break;
    7696           0 :         case offsetof(struct __sk_buff, sk):
    7697           0 :                 if (type == BPF_WRITE || size != sizeof(__u64))
    7698             :                         return false;
    7699           0 :                 info->reg_type = PTR_TO_SOCK_COMMON_OR_NULL;
    7700           0 :                 break;
    7701           0 :         default:
    7702             :                 /* Only narrow read access allowed for now. */
    7703           0 :                 if (type == BPF_WRITE) {
    7704           0 :                         if (size != size_default)
    7705           0 :                                 return false;
    7706             :                 } else {
    7707           0 :                         bpf_ctx_record_field_size(info, size_default);
    7708           0 :                         if (!bpf_ctx_narrow_access_ok(off, size, size_default))
    7709           0 :                                 return false;
    7710             :                 }
    7711             :         }
    7712             : 
    7713             :         return true;
    7714             : }

    7825             : /* Attach type specific accesses */
    7826           0 : static bool __sock_filter_check_attach_type(int off,
    7827             :                                             enum bpf_access_type access_type,
    7828             :                                             enum bpf_attach_type attach_type)
    7829             : {
    7830           0 :         switch (off) {
    7831           0 :         case offsetof(struct bpf_sock, bound_dev_if):
    7832             :         case offsetof(struct bpf_sock, mark):
    7833             :         case offsetof(struct bpf_sock, priority):
    7834           0 :                 switch (attach_type) {
    7835           0 :                 case BPF_CGROUP_INET_SOCK_CREATE:
    7836             :                 case BPF_CGROUP_INET_SOCK_RELEASE:
    7837           0 :                         goto full_access;
    7838             :                 default:
    7839             :                         return false;
    7840             :                 }
    7841           0 :         case bpf_ctx_range(struct bpf_sock, src_ip4):

    7931           0 : static int bpf_unclone_prologue(struct bpf_insn *insn_buf, bool direct_write,
    7932             :                                 const struct bpf_prog *prog, int drop_verdict)
    7933             : {
    7934           0 :         struct bpf_insn *insn = insn_buf;
    7935             : 
    7936           0 :         if (!direct_write)
    7937             :                 return 0;
    7938             : 
    7939             :         /* if (!skb->cloned)
    7940             :          *       goto start;
    7941             :          *
    7942             :          * (Fast-path, otherwise approximation that we might be
    7943             :          *  a clone, do the rest in helper.)
    7944             :          */
    7945           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_B, BPF_REG_6, BPF_REG_1, CLONED_OFFSET());
    7946           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_ALU32_IMM(BPF_AND, BPF_REG_6, CLONED_MASK);
    7947           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JEQ, BPF_REG_6, 0, 7);
    7948             : 
    7949             :         /* ret = bpf_skb_pull_data(skb, 0); */
    7950           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_6, BPF_REG_1);
    7951           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_ALU64_REG(BPF_XOR, BPF_REG_2, BPF_REG_2);
    7952           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_RAW_INSN(BPF_JMP | BPF_CALL, 0, 0, 0,
    7953             :                                BPF_FUNC_skb_pull_data);
    7954             :         /* if (!ret)
    7955             :          *      goto restore;
    7956             :          * return TC_ACT_SHOT;
    7957             :          */
    7958           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JEQ, BPF_REG_0, 0, 2);
    7959           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_ALU32_IMM(BPF_MOV, BPF_REG_0, drop_verdict);
    7960           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_EXIT_INSN();
    7961             : 
    7962             :         /* restore: */
    7963           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_1, BPF_REG_6);
    7964             :         /* start: */
    7965           0 :         *insn++ = prog->insnsi[0];
    7966             : 
    7967           0 :         return insn - insn_buf;
    7968             : }
    7969             : 
    7970           0 : static int bpf_gen_ld_abs(const struct bpf_insn *orig,
    7971             :                           struct bpf_insn *insn_buf)
    7972             : {
    7973           0 :         bool indirect = BPF_MODE(orig->code) == BPF_IND;
    7974           0 :         struct bpf_insn *insn = insn_buf;
    7975             : 
    7976           0 :         if (!indirect) {
    7977           0 :                 *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_IMM(BPF_REG_2, orig->imm);
    7978             :         } else {
    7979           0 :                 *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_2, orig->src_reg);
    7980           0 :                 if (orig->imm)
    7981           0 :                         *insn++ = BPF_ALU64_IMM(BPF_ADD, BPF_REG_2, orig->imm);
    7982             :         }
    7983             :         /* We're guaranteed here that CTX is in R6. */
    7984           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_MOV64_REG(BPF_REG_1, BPF_REG_CTX);
    7985             : 
    7986           0 :         switch (BPF_SIZE(orig->code)) {
    7987           0 :         case BPF_B:
    7988           0 :                 *insn++ = BPF_EMIT_CALL(bpf_skb_load_helper_8_no_cache);
    7989           0 :                 break;
    7990           0 :         case BPF_H:
    7991           0 :                 *insn++ = BPF_EMIT_CALL(bpf_skb_load_helper_16_no_cache);
    7992           0 :                 break;
    7993           0 :         case BPF_W:
    7994           0 :                 *insn++ = BPF_EMIT_CALL(bpf_skb_load_helper_32_no_cache);
    7995           0 :                 break;
    7996             :         }
    7997             : 
    7998           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JSGE, BPF_REG_0, 0, 2);
    7999           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_ALU32_REG(BPF_XOR, BPF_REG_0, BPF_REG_0);
    8000           0 :         *insn++ = BPF_EXIT_INSN();
    8001             : 
    8002           0 :         return insn - insn_buf;
    8003             : }

    8322             :         }

    8733             : #endif
    8734           0 :                 break;
    8735             : 
    8736             :         case offsetof(struct __sk_buff, remote_port):
    8737           0 :                 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof_field(struct sock_common, skc_dport) != 2);
    8738             :

    8740             :                                       si->dst_reg, si->src_reg,
    8741             :                                       offsetof(struct sk_buff, sk));

    8743             :                                       bpf_target_off(struct sock_common,
    8744             :                                                      skc_dport,
    8745             :                                                      2, target_size));

    8748             : #endif
    8749           0 :                 break;

    8755             :                                       si->dst_reg, si->src_reg,

    9000           0 :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(struct sk_buff, dev),

    9004             :                                       bpf_target_off(struct net_device, ifindex, 4,
    9005             :                                                      target_size));
    9006           0 :                 break;

    9009             :                                               target_size);
    9010             :         }
    9011             :

    9015           0 : static u32 xdp_convert_ctx_access(enum bpf_access_type type,
    9016             :                                   const struct bpf_insn *si,

    9018             :                                   struct bpf_prog *prog, u32 *target_size)

    9025             :                                       si->dst_reg, si->src_reg,
    9026             :                                       offsetof(struct xdp_buff, data));
    9027           0 :                 break;
    9028           0 :         case offsetof(struct xdp_md, data_meta):
    9029           0 :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(struct xdp_buff, data_meta),
    9030             :                                       si->dst_reg, si->src_reg,
    9031             :                                       offsetof(struct xdp_buff, data_meta));

    9035             :                                       si->dst_reg, si->src_reg,

    9069             : }
    9070             : 
    9071             : /* SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_NESTED_FIELD() loads Nested Field S.F.NF where S is type of
    9072             :  * context Structure, F is Field in context structure that contains a pointer
    9073             :  * to Nested Structure of type NS that has the field NF.
    9074             :  *
    9075             :  * SIZE encodes the load size (BPF_B, BPF_H, etc). It's up to caller to make
    9076             :  * sure that SIZE is not greater than actual size of S.F.NF.
    9077             :  *
    9078             :  * If offset OFF is provided, the load happens from that offset relative to
    9079             :  * offset of NF.
    9080             :  */
    9081             : #define SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_NESTED_FIELD_SIZE_OFF(S, NS, F, NF, SIZE, OFF)          \
    9082             :         do {                                                                   \
    9083             :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(S, F), si->dst_reg,     \
    9084             :                                       si->src_reg, offsetof(S, F));         \
    9085             :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(                                         \
    9086             :                         SIZE, si->dst_reg, si->dst_reg,                          \
    9087             :                         bpf_target_off(NS, NF, sizeof_field(NS, NF),           \
    9088             :                                        target_size)                            \
    9089             :                                 + OFF);                                        \
    9090             :         } while (0)
    9091             : 
    9092             : #define SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_NESTED_FIELD(S, NS, F, NF)                              \
    9093             :         SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_NESTED_FIELD_SIZE_OFF(S, NS, F, NF,                     \
    9094             :                                              BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(NS, NF), 0)
    9095             : 
    9096             : /* SOCK_ADDR_STORE_NESTED_FIELD_OFF() has semantic similar to
    9097             :  * SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_NESTED_FIELD_SIZE_OFF() but for store operation.
    9098             :  *
    9099             :  * In addition it uses Temporary Field TF (member of struct S) as the 3rd
    9100             :  * "register" since two registers available in convert_ctx_access are not
    9101             :  * enough: we can't override neither SRC, since it contains value to store, nor
    9102             :  * DST since it contains pointer to context that may be used by later
    9103             :  * instructions. But we need a temporary place to save pointer to nested
    9104             :  * structure whose field we want to store to.
    9105             :  */
    9106             : #define SOCK_ADDR_STORE_NESTED_FIELD_OFF(S, NS, F, NF, SIZE, OFF, TF)          \
    9107             :         do {                                                                   \
    9108             :                 int tmp_reg = BPF_REG_9;                                       \
    9109             :                 if (si->src_reg == tmp_reg || si->dst_reg == tmp_reg)            \
    9110             :                         --tmp_reg;                                             \
    9111             :                 if (si->src_reg == tmp_reg || si->dst_reg == tmp_reg)            \
    9112             :                         --tmp_reg;                                             \
    9113             :                 *insn++ = BPF_STX_MEM(BPF_DW, si->dst_reg, tmp_reg,         \
    9114             :                                       offsetof(S, TF));                        \
    9115             :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(S, F), tmp_reg,         \
    9116             :                                       si->dst_reg, offsetof(S, F));         \
    9117             :                 *insn++ = BPF_STX_MEM(SIZE, tmp_reg, si->src_reg,           \
    9118             :                         bpf_target_off(NS, NF, sizeof_field(NS, NF),           \
    9119             :                                        target_size)                            \
    9120             :                                 + OFF);                                        \
    9121             :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_DW, tmp_reg, si->dst_reg,         \
    9122             :                                       offsetof(S, TF));                        \
    9123             :         } while (0)
    9124             : 
    9125             : #define SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_OR_STORE_NESTED_FIELD_SIZE_OFF(S, NS, F, NF, SIZE, OFF, \
    9126             :                                                       TF)                      \
    9127             :         do {                                                                   \
    9128             :                 if (type == BPF_WRITE) {                                       \
    9129             :                         SOCK_ADDR_STORE_NESTED_FIELD_OFF(S, NS, F, NF, SIZE,   \
    9130             :                                                          OFF, TF);             \
    9131             :                 } else {                                                       \
    9132             :                         SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_NESTED_FIELD_SIZE_OFF(                  \
    9133             :                                 S, NS, F, NF, SIZE, OFF);  \
    9134             :                 }                                                              \
    9135             :         } while (0)
    9136             : 
    9137             : #define SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_OR_STORE_NESTED_FIELD(S, NS, F, NF, TF)                 \
    9138             :         SOCK_ADDR_LOAD_OR_STORE_NESTED_FIELD_SIZE_OFF(                         \

    9230           0 : static u32 sock_ops_convert_ctx_access(enum bpf_access_type type,

    9237           0 :         int off;
    9238             : 
    9239             : /* Helper macro for adding read access to tcp_sock or sock fields. */
    9240             : #define SOCK_OPS_GET_FIELD(BPF_FIELD, OBJ_FIELD, OBJ)                         \
    9241             :         do {                                                                  \
    9242             :                 int fullsock_reg = si->dst_reg, reg = BPF_REG_9, jmp = 2;     \
    9243             :                 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof_field(OBJ, OBJ_FIELD) >                \
    9244             :                              sizeof_field(struct bpf_sock_ops, BPF_FIELD));   \
    9245             :                 if (si->dst_reg == reg || si->src_reg == reg)                   \
    9246             :                         reg--;                                                \
    9247             :                 if (si->dst_reg == reg || si->src_reg == reg)                   \
    9248             :                         reg--;                                                \

    9319             : 
    9320             : #define SOCK_OPS_GET_TCP_SOCK_FIELD(FIELD) \
    9321             :                 SOCK_OPS_GET_FIELD(FIELD, FIELD, struct tcp_sock)
    9322             : 
    9323             : /* Helper macro for adding write access to tcp_sock or sock fields.
    9324             :  * The macro is called with two registers, dst_reg which contains a pointer
    9325             :  * to ctx (context) and src_reg which contains the value that should be
    9326             :  * stored. However, we need an additional register since we cannot overwrite
    9327             :  * dst_reg because it may be used later in the program.
    9328             :  * Instead we "borrow" one of the other register. We first save its value
    9329             :  * into a new (temp) field in bpf_sock_ops_kern, use it, and then restore
    9330             :  * it at the end of the macro.
    9331             :  */
    9332             : #define SOCK_OPS_SET_FIELD(BPF_FIELD, OBJ_FIELD, OBJ)                         \
    9333             :         do {                                                                  \
    9334             :                 int reg = BPF_REG_9;                                          \
    9335             :                 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof_field(OBJ, OBJ_FIELD) >                \
    9336             :                              sizeof_field(struct bpf_sock_ops, BPF_FIELD));   \
    9337             :                 if (si->dst_reg == reg || si->src_reg == reg)                   \
    9338             :                         reg--;                                                \
    9339             :                 if (si->dst_reg == reg || si->src_reg == reg)                   \
    9340             :                         reg--;                                                \
    9341             :                 *insn++ = BPF_STX_MEM(BPF_DW, si->dst_reg, reg,                    \
    9342             :                                       offsetof(struct bpf_sock_ops_kern,      \
    9343             :                                                temp));                        \
    9344             :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(                       \
    9345             :                                                 struct bpf_sock_ops_kern,     \
    9346             :                                                 is_fullsock),                 \
    9347             :                                       reg, si->dst_reg,                            \
    9348             :                                       offsetof(struct bpf_sock_ops_kern,      \
    9349             :                                                is_fullsock));                 \
    9350             :                 *insn++ = BPF_JMP_IMM(BPF_JEQ, reg, 0, 2);                    \
    9351             :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(                       \
    9352             :                                                 struct bpf_sock_ops_kern, sk),\
    9353             :                                       reg, si->dst_reg,                            \
    9354             :                                       offsetof(struct bpf_sock_ops_kern, sk));\
    9355             :                 *insn++ = BPF_STX_MEM(BPF_FIELD_SIZEOF(OBJ, OBJ_FIELD),       \
    9356             :                                       reg, si->src_reg,                            \
    9357             :                                       offsetof(OBJ, OBJ_FIELD));              \
    9358             :                 *insn++ = BPF_LDX_MEM(BPF_DW, reg, si->dst_reg,                    \
    9359             :                                       offsetof(struct bpf_sock_ops_kern,      \
    9360             :                                                temp));                        \
    9361             :         } while (0)
    9362             : 
    9363             : #define SOCK_OPS_GET_OR_SET_FIELD(BPF_FIELD, OBJ_FIELD, OBJ, TYPE)            \

    9365             :                 if (TYPE == BPF_WRITE)                                        \
    9366             :                         SOCK_OPS_SET_FIELD(BPF_FIELD, OBJ_FIELD, OBJ);        \

    9368             :                         SOCK_OPS_GET_FIELD(BPF_FIELD, OBJ_FIELD, OBJ);        \

   10001             :          * so no conversion/decode needed anymore. eBPF programs that
